work. Ol' Patty is a tool outside of his production skills, but hey...gotta

----- Original Message ----- 
From: "donb" <mutex@drghetto.com>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Monday, February 28, 2005 9:04 PM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] BSP: Folded - More Info


> Wow, this response was totally fantastic as I haven't been following
> house so much and wasn't familiar with Turnaround-Sound, needed to be
> reminded of some of the smaller club things, etc.. Very informative, you
> rock! Turnaround is a powerhouse collection of producer/DJs, plus a
> Patrick Turner release! Fucking awesome.
>
> donb
>
>
> georgeC | origami wrote:
>
>>--- donb <mutex@drghetto.com> wrote:
>>
>>
>>
>>>Something I have noticed for years now with DJ's and crews and BSPs
>>>and
>>>stuff is the long trail of affiliations that come after a name.
>>>Sometimes it's really cool because I see a label I like or a crew I
>>>am
>>>down with, sometimes it is a total mystery or even an inside joke
>>>amongst crew or family.
>>>
>>>
>>
>>Good point, Don.  Here's a bit of background on the ones we posted, and
>>I think I'll append a little blurb with further info on it to further
>>posts of ours.
>>
>>(btw, you may know some or all of this info, just posting so folks that
>>don't will be filled in)
>>
>>Turnaround-Sound is a local house label owned by Sen-Sei, noted
>>keyboardist who is known for playing live with djs and for contributing
>>keys to a lot of prominent folks' productions as well as his own.  TAS
>>is on their second release now (a track by Andrew and I called "Friday
>>Night" with a Chris Lum remix and some remixes by Sen-Sei, and Naz of
>>In-House fame).  The previous release was a Patrick Turner track with a
>>really good mix by Jeno and more mixes by Sen-Sei and Naz.
>>
>>Sen-Sei is playing with Andrew and I this friday, doing his
>>live-keys-over-dj-music thing.  He'll be tag-teaming with our pal RFM,
>>who plays in the local band Loquat- another exceptional keyboardist.
>>
>>Sf-Vibe is a local promoter group that tends to throw deep/funky house
>>music events.  They do smaller club stuff (like Taco Tuesdays at Luna
>>and Cruise Liner at Lingba Lounge) and some larger big-club events.
>>Jonas does promotion with them and plays at some of the events.
>>
>>newstylesound is my little deep tech house label (you knew that :)
>>which is gearing up to release a new 12" soon, a track of mine
>>(Origami) called "Everydaylife" with remixes by dj2 and Andrew and I.
>>
>>Olive Records is a Chicago-based record label that is co-owned by
>>french house guys Synthique (aka Max & Brian).  They put out some
>>big-room banging stuff (like High Caliber) and some jazzier chicago-y
>>stuff (like Sound Navigators, who Andrew and I did a remix for on
>>Olive), along with Synthique's frenchy frenchy stuff.  They are cool
>>cats and all the records of theirs I've heard are great.
>>
>>Pancake is Grant Dell (UK tech-house dj/producer)'s label (or one of
>>them).  They recently re-issued dj2 (Delaney Parker and I's duo)'s
>>first single, "Plural" with a mix by Mazi.  Great music so far on that
>>label, the previous release being a celebrated cut by Masonic Noodles.
>>
>>..and you know Thump Radio, but for those that don't, they're a driving
>>force in the local trance/house/chill community, throwing many club
>>events large and small, along with their weekly dj mix shows that play
>>on XM radio as well as select FM stations.
>>
>>That be that, I think.
>>
>>Cheers mate,
>>---
>>-george C | origami
>>-newstylesound recordings
>>-newstylesound.com
>>-djorigami.com
>>-foldedsf
>>
>>---------------------------------------------------------------------
>>To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
>>For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>

Subject: [sfraves] Track ID

Hey there, i was wondering if any of you could help me ID a certain
track.  I heard it at the Cloudfactory 10 yr.  Unfortunatly i was
sitting up on top of the big slope and i didnt want to walk down to
find out what track it was.

All i can remember from it, was the sample.

It would start saying a bunch of colors, like yellow, red, green, muave...etc.
Then it would say Color Spectrum, and then cycle through the colors
again.  Fucking awesome track.  if any of you out there know what the
name of that track is please help me out.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Nrr: anyone got an old verizon compat. cellphone for sale/give?

watch out for that shit man...

i used to work for verizon. whatever you do make sure
lockline gives you a NEW phone. their refurbished
pieces of shit always fail, especially if they give
you a motorola. ask for a new one. it would be too
late to add insurance if you already lost your phone
and reported it as lost. but if it's just damaged and
you have a phone on there where they can call and
verify that its a working phone then go for it.
otherwise i suggest craigslist or ebay. 

-D.

On Mon, 28 Feb 2005 12:28:51 -0800 (PST), georgeC | origami
<newstylesound@yahoo.com> wrote:
> --- donb <mutex@drghetto.com> wrote:
> 
> > Something I have noticed for years now with DJ's and crews and BSPs
> > and
> > stuff is the long trail of affiliations that come after a name.
> > Sometimes it's really cool because I see a label I like or a crew I
> > am
> > down with, sometimes it is a total mystery or even an inside joke
> > amongst crew or family.
> 
> Good point, Don.  Here's a bit of background on the ones we posted, and
> I think I'll append a little blurb with further info on it to further
> posts of ours.
> 
> (btw, you may know some or all of this info, just posting so folks that
> don't will be filled in)
> 
> Turnaround-Sound is a local house label owned by Sen-Sei, noted
> keyboardist who is known for playing live with djs and for contributing
> keys to a lot of prominent folks' productions as well as his own.  TAS
> is on their second release now (a track by Andrew and I called "Friday
> Night" with a Chris Lum remix and some remixes by Sen-Sei, and Naz of
> In-House fame).  The previous release was a Patrick Turner track with a
> really good mix by Jeno and more mixes by Sen-Sei and Naz.
> 
> Sen-Sei is playing with Andrew and I this friday, doing his
> live-keys-over-dj-music thing.  He'll be tag-teaming with our pal RFM,
> who plays in the local band Loquat- another exceptional keyboardist.
> 
> Sf-Vibe is a local promoter group that tends to throw deep/funky house
> music events.  They do smaller club stuff (like Taco Tuesdays at Luna
> and Cruise Liner at Lingba Lounge) and some larger big-club events.
> Jonas does promotion with them and plays at some of the events.
> 
> newstylesound is my little deep tech house label (you knew that :)
> which is gearing up to release a new 12" soon, a track of mine
> (Origami) called "Everydaylife" with remixes by dj2 and Andrew and I.
> 
> Olive Records is a Chicago-based record label that is co-owned by
> french house guys Synthique (aka Max & Brian).  They put out some
> big-room banging stuff (like High Caliber) and some jazzier chicago-y
> stuff (like Sound Navigators, who Andrew and I did a remix for on
> Olive), along with Synthique's frenchy frenchy stuff.  They are cool
> cats and all the records of theirs I've heard are great.
> 
> Pancake is Grant Dell (UK tech-house dj/producer)'s label (or one of
> them).  They recently re-issued dj2 (Delaney Parker and I's duo)'s
> first single, "Plural" with a mix by Mazi.  Great music so far on that
> label, the previous release being a celebrated cut by Masonic Noodles.
> 
> ..and you know Thump Radio, but for those that don't, they're a driving
> force in the local trance/house/chill community, throwing many club
> events large and small, along with their weekly dj mix shows that play
> on XM radio as well as select FM stations.
> 
> That be that, I think.
> 
> Cheers mate,
> ---
> -george C | origami
> -newstylesound recordings
> -newstylesound.com
> -djorigami.com
> -foldedsf
>

Subject: [sfraves] Artists Break With Industry on File Sharing

--=====================_3025350==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed


Artists Break With Industry on File Sharing

Some Musicians Say Web Services Can Be Valuable Means
of Distribution

By Jonathan Krim
Washington Post Staff Writer
Tuesday, March 1, 2005; Page E05

A prominent group of musicians and artists, breaking
with colleagues and the major entertainment studios, is
urging the Supreme Court not to hold online file-
sharing services responsible for the acts of users who
illegally trade songs, movies and software.

MORE:  http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/articles/A61254-2005Feb28.html




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


The US is:  "...a nation of 200 million used-car salesmen with all the 
money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the 
world who tries to make us uncomfortable."
-Hunter S. Thompson

"Sometime in your life, hope that you might see one starved man, the look 
on his face when the bread finally arrives.  Hope that you might have 
bought it or baked it or even kneaded it yourself.  For that look on his 
face, for your meeting his eyes across a piece of bread, you might be 
willing to lose a lot, or suffer a lot, or die a little, even."
-Daniel Berrigan

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

From: Deepfog <sfgroove@deepfog.com>

To: The Twilight Laser Outpost <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
X-Mailer: Apple Mail (2.619.2)
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Spirit of Raving Question: Your definition of PLUR

oh you're gonna just love me for this one ... but a lot of you will 
probably understand me a lot more after this ...

i haven't spent the last 12 years living in the values of peace, love, 
unity, respect.  i try a lot of the time, but i get easily frustrated 
because i don't think enough other people are living their lives 
anything close to peace, love, unity and respect.

i think PLUR to me is just a phrase, because i was around the scene 
before that saying became popular.  i tend to resist labels and tags on 
human behavior, so that's why i resisted this saying ... because i 
think true peace, love, unity and respect often has no words to 
describe it, just as i think true religion has no church to house it.  
it's all what we create in our minds.  but if it's a way of life for 
other people, i think that's fine.

hope that helps ...

-d

> motto, phrase or a way of life? What inspired you to live in the 
> values of Peace, Love, Unity, Respect?
>
> <3 Karina
>
> --

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Spirit of Raving Question: Your definition of PLUR

I'd say that about hits it on the head for me too.

It's the same reason I don't buy into the whole organized religion thing. 
You shouldn't need a church, a priest, a guru or shaman, nor catch phrase 
(or whatever) to make you a peaceful person, a person who believes in unity, 
or being respectful, or loving your fellow human beings. You should just do 
it. Also (and maybe it's just the asshole in me), some people aren't worth 
being respectful to or giving love to. Some people are just plain shitty.

Of course it's all just a matter of opinion, and totally up to each 
individuals perogative to decide that sorta thing. I'm certainly not 
claiming to know what's good for anyone else....

~M

Function: noun
Etymology: Sanskrit tAla, literally, hand-clapping
: one of the ancient traditional rhythmic patterns of Indian music --
compare RAGA

Date: Wed, 2 Mar 2005 16:16:16 -0800 (PST)
From: georgeC | origami <newstylesound@yahoo.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
In-Reply-To: <BAY21-DAV99BBB575271360962A47B855A0@phx.gbl>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Spirit of Raving Question: Your definition of PLUR

Ok, so detached from our collective dislike for labels, catch phrases,
spiritual doctrines, etc, let's look at PLUR for what it is, or what it
tries to be..

..which is, simply, a damn good idea- and one I see plenty of scene
folks ignoring.

Karina has quite a bit of balls to ask a question like this on a list
as jaded as this one- to me, in the areas of the scene that have
petrified, the state of things can be traced back to a distinct lack
of:

Peace: Drama abounds.  We aren't hurting eachother physically but we
certainly aren't always taking one another's happiness seriously.

Love: There is a lot of "hate" or just sort of regimented dislike in
some areas of the scene.  In some groups, it is de rigeur to hate
certain other groups or individuals.  Shit talking has been elevated to
an artform.  

Unity: See the above, and notice also how, even within your circle or
the 'heads that listen to your favorite music, how few people support
their scene or *gasp* anybody else's efforts.  See how many broken
friendships and strained relationships litter the roads of ravedom like
so much roadkill.

Respect:  See above.  

---

Now in the parts of the scene I see thriving, and in my own friends
circle (for the most part), I see a kind of realistic PLUR applied. 
You  might not Love, Respect, or desire Unity with *everyone* as it
stands, but you're working toward it, within yourself at the very
least.  ..and everybody wants Peace, in the end.

PLUR is what is right with every counterculture movement when it is
thriving, even ones you might think of as brash and violent (punks,
industro-goths, etc), and what is missing when they're at a low point.

Plur,
-gc

--- VanMundegaarde <electrofunk138@hotmail.com> wrote:

> phrase 
> (or whatever) to make you a peaceful person, a person who believes in
> unity, 
> or being respectful, or loving your fellow human beings. You should
> just do 
> it. Also (and maybe it's just the asshole in me), some people aren't
> worth 
> being respectful to or giving love to. Some people are just plain
> shitty.
> 
> Of course it's all just a matter of opinion, and totally up to each 
> individuals perogative to decide that sorta thing. I'm certainly not 
> claiming to know what's good for anyone else....

> ---------------------------------------------------------------------
> To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
> For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org
>
>


-- 
Main Entry: 1tala
Pronunciation: 't-l&
Function: noun
Etymology: Sanskrit tAla, literally, hand-clapping
: one of the ancient traditional rhythmic patterns of Indian music --
compare RAGA

----- Original Message ----- 
From: "georgeC | origami" <newstylesound@yahoo.com>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Wednesday, March 02, 2005 4:16 PM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Spirit of Raving Question: Your definition of PLUR


> Ok, so detached from our collective dislike for labels, catch phrases,
> spiritual doctrines, etc, let's look at PLUR for what it is, or what it
> tries to be..
>
> ..which is, simply, a damn good idea- and one I see plenty of scene
> folks ignoring.
>
> Karina has quite a bit of balls to ask a question like this on a list
> as jaded as this one- to me, in the areas of the scene that have
> petrified, the state of things can be traced back to a distinct lack
> of:
>
> Peace: Drama abounds.  We aren't hurting eachother physically but we
> certainly aren't always taking one another's happiness seriously.
>
> Love: There is a lot of "hate" or just sort of regimented dislike in
> some areas of the scene.  In some groups, it is de rigeur to hate
> certain other groups or individuals.  Shit talking has been elevated to
> an artform.
>
> Unity: See the above, and notice also how, even within your circle or
> the 'heads that listen to your favorite music, how few people support
> their scene or *gasp* anybody else's efforts.  See how many broken
> friendships and strained relationships litter the roads of ravedom like
> so much roadkill.
>
> Respect:  See above.
>
> ---
>
> Now in the parts of the scene I see thriving, and in my own friends
> circle (for the most part), I see a kind of realistic PLUR applied.
> You  might not Love, Respect, or desire Unity with *everyone* as it
> stands, but you're working toward it, within yourself at the very
> least.  ..and everybody wants Peace, in the end.
>
> PLUR is what is right with every counterculture movement when it is
> thriving, even ones you might think of as brash and violent (punks,
> industro-goths, etc), and what is missing when they're at a low point.
>
> Plur,
> -gc
>
> --- VanMundegaarde <electrofunk138@hotmail.com> wrote:
>

>> thing.

>> phrase
>> (or whatever) to make you a peaceful person, a person who believes in
>> unity,
>> or being respectful, or loving your fellow human beings. You should
>> just do

>> worth
>> being respectful to or giving love to. Some people are just plain
>> shitty.
>>
>> Of course it's all just a matter of opinion, and totally up to each
>> individuals perogative to decide that sorta thing. I'm certainly not
>> claiming to know what's good for anyone else....

Subject: [sfraves] AFRIKA BAMBAATAA:  ALL MUSIC IS DANCE MUSIC 

--=====================_8664538==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

AFRIKA BAMBAATAA:  ALL MUSIC IS DANCE MUSIC


By Nathan Rabin

One of hip-hop's true pioneers, Afrika Bambaataa has made it his life's 
goal to break down barriers between genres and races alike. A onetime gang 
member, Bambaataa went on to form Zulu Nation, an idealistic, expansive 
organization that played a vital role in hip-hop's birth and development, 
putting on shows, helping define the culture, and generally helping expand 
the genre's music and ethos.

Bambaataa reigned as one of early hip-hop's most influential and 
sought-after DJ. He scored a seminal breakthrough hit with 1982's "Planet 
Rock," a perfect, oft-imitated single that helped define and perfect 
electrofunk by expertly blending old-school braggadocio with chilly Euro 
synthesizers straight out of Kraftwerk. The fusion of genres and 
sensibilities became an important theme in his music as he engaged in 
high-profile, genre-redefining collaborations with James Brown and Sex 
Pistols/PIL frontman John Lydon. Bambaataa's wildly eclectic tastes can be 
felt in his popular DJ sets, where he'll regularly throw AC/DC's "You Shook 
Me All Night Long" or the Andy Griffith Show theme song into sets otherwise 
dominated by more conventional dance fare.

Bambaataa continues to record and tour, serving as a respected elder 
statesman and goodwill ambassador for the genre he helped create and 
popularize. His latest album is 2004's Dark Matter Moving At The Speed of 
Light. The Onion A.V. Club recently spoke with the venerable icon about 
hip-hop, politics, and the secret messages behind movies.

http://www.theonionavclub.com/feature/index.php?issue=4109&f=1






Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


The US is:  "...a nation of 200 million used-car salesmen with all the 
money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the 
world who tries to make us uncomfortable."
-Hunter S. Thompson

"Sometime in your life, hope that you might see one starved man, the look 
on his face when the bread finally arrives.  Hope that you might have 
bought it or baked it or even kneaded it yourself.  For that look on his 
face, for your meeting his eyes across a piece of bread, you might be 
willing to lose a lot, or suffer a lot, or die a little, even."
-Daniel Berrigan

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"



--=====================_8664538==.ALT--

> Seen.
>
> But man...if you think SFR is jaded, try mentioning PLUR on DCRaves...lol.
> That's the PLUR hatinest "rave" list I have ever seen in my life. Jaded is
> an understatement fo 'sho.
> ----- Original Message ----- 
> From: "georgeC | origami" <newstylesound@yahoo.com>
> To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
> Sent: Wednesday, March 02, 2005 4:16 PM
> Subject: Re: [sfraves] Spirit of Raving Question: Your definition of PLUR
>
>
> > Ok, so detached from our collective dislike for labels, catch phrases,
> > spiritual doctrines, etc, let's look at PLUR for what it is, or what it
> > tries to be..
> >
> > ..which is, simply, a damn good idea- and one I see plenty of scene
> > folks ignoring.
> >
> > Karina has quite a bit of balls to ask a question like this on a list
> > as jaded as this one- to me, in the areas of the scene that have
> > petrified, the state of things can be traced back to a distinct lack
> > of:
> >
> > Peace: Drama abounds.  We aren't hurting eachother physically but we
> > certainly aren't always taking one another's happiness seriously.
> >
> > Love: There is a lot of "hate" or just sort of regimented dislike in
> > some areas of the scene.  In some groups, it is de rigeur to hate
> > certain other groups or individuals.  Shit talking has been elevated to
> > an artform.
> >
> > Unity: See the above, and notice also how, even within your circle or
> > the 'heads that listen to your favorite music, how few people support
> > their scene or *gasp* anybody else's efforts.  See how many broken
> > friendships and strained relationships litter the roads of ravedom like
> > so much roadkill.
> >
> > Respect:  See above.
> >
> > ---
> >
> > Now in the parts of the scene I see thriving, and in my own friends
> > circle (for the most part), I see a kind of realistic PLUR applied.
> > You  might not Love, Respect, or desire Unity with *everyone* as it
> > stands, but you're working toward it, within yourself at the very
> > least.  ..and everybody wants Peace, in the end.
> >
> > PLUR is what is right with every counterculture movement when it is
> > thriving, even ones you might think of as brash and violent (punks,
> > industro-goths, etc), and what is missing when they're at a low point.
> >
> > Plur,
> > -gc
> >
> > --- VanMundegaarde <electrofunk138@hotmail.com> wrote:
> >
> >> I'd say that about hits it on the head for me too.
> >>
> >> It's the same reason I don't buy into the whole organized religion
> >> thing.
> >> You shouldn't need a church, a priest, a guru or shaman, nor catch
> >> phrase
> >> (or whatever) to make you a peaceful person, a person who believes in
> >> unity,
> >> or being respectful, or loving your fellow human beings. You should
> >> just do
> >> it. Also (and maybe it's just the asshole in me), some people aren't
> >> worth
> >> being respectful to or giving love to. Some people are just plain
> >> shitty.
> >>
> >> Of course it's all just a matter of opinion, and totally up to each
> >> individuals perogative to decide that sorta thing. I'm certainly not
> >> claiming to know what's good for anyone else....

Subject: [sfraves] Sat May 21st - HCFTP - Digga Beat 3, Hardcore/D&B/Trance/ Hardsyle/Gabber

E.N.D (Goodfellaz Crew, Pitched Up Recordings, Happyhardcore.com-
Toronto, Canada)
Coming from Toronto, E.N.D got his start MCing in the summer of 2001.
In 2002 he hooked up with the Goodfellaz Crew in Toronto to make a
permanent transition into hardcore MCing and DJing.E.N.D joined the
Pitched Up roster in the winter of 2003 and along with Hi-IQ, has
worked hard pumping up hardcore and non-hardcore crowds across North
America! HCFTP is proud to provide and represent TRUE Hardcore talent.

Pistachio vs. Anonymous (www.djpistachio.com)
Back in 1999 these two dj's tore up dance floors all over CA. After
the end of HomeBase and Second and Jackson these two dj's fell off the
radar. It's been almost 4 years since we have had the pleasure of
seeing these two artists perform. Welcome back two of the best dj's in
the bay area trance scene! The return of Pistachio & Anonymous!


No left Turn (LiquidVinyl/KFA)
Michael Liu (Illumination Records)
The Doctor (DTS/BR Prod/Liquidvinyldjs/Rhythm Method) W/ MC Fader
MollyMush (HCFTP/RAVE N' BEATS USA)
Go-Zania (HCFTP)
Reclipse (DTS/Br Prod)
Paul Riley (HCFTP/DTS)
SecondBase (HCFTP/EVO)
HI-C (NU VISION)
Joey Frisco (DTS)


$10
We will also be celebrating Mateas B-day :)

Stay posted for updates.

Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; CHARSET=ISO-8859-1; FORMAT=flowed

Happy 303 / 0303 :)

Doing a quick search on google showed some significance of this number...=
=20
Any Math geeks here want to take a shot?

Here are results for this number :

1) US copyright law TITLE 17 > CHAPTER 3 > =A7 303
http://assembler.law.cornell.edu/uscode/html/uscode17/usc_sec_17_00000303--=
--000-.html

=A7 303. Duration of copyright: Works created but not published or=20
copyrighted before January 1, 1978

Release date: 2004-04-30

(a) Copyright in a work created before January 1, 1978, but not=20
theretofore in the public domain or copyrighted, subsists from January 1,=
=20
1978, and endures for the term provided by section 302. In no case,=20
however, shall the term of copyright in such a work expire before December=
=20
31, 2002; and, if the work is published on or before December 31, 2002,=20
the term of copyright shall not expire before December 31, 2047.
(b) The distribution before January 1, 1978, of a phonorecord shall not=20
for any purpose constitute a publication of the musical work embodied=20
therein.

2) Vintage Synth - Roland TB-303

3) In the Year 303:


303
From=20Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia.
Years:
299 300 301 302 - 303 - 304 305 306 307
Decades:
270s 280s 290s - 300s - 310s 320s 330s
Centuries:
3rd century - 4th century - 5th century

Events

     * Diocletian launched the last major persecution of Christians in the=
=20
Roman Empire; Hierocles was said to have been the instigator of the fierce=
=20
persecution of the Christians under Galerius.
     * February 24 - Galerius, Roman Emperor, publishes his edict that=20
begins the persecution of Christians in his portion of the Empire.
     * Sassanid Shah Hormizd II succeeded Narseh.

Deaths

     * April 23 - Saint George, soldier of the Roman Empire and later=20
Christian martyr.
     * Adrian of Nicomedia, Christian saint (or 304)
     * Cao Huan, last emperor of the Kingdom of Wei
     * Expeditus, Roman commander and martyr

4) 303net.com
http://www.303net.com/

A network of sites and artists producing electronic music -=20
techno/ambient/dance, featuring the DoubleMirrors soundtrack.

5) 303 Dreams
The home of 303 Dreams, The Toronto Electronica Act.
http://listen.to/303dreams

6) Marine Helicopter Training Squadron 303
Commanding Officer, HMT-303, Commanding Officer Marine Helicopter Training=
=20
Squadron 303
http://www.3maw.usmc.mil/mag39/hmt303/default.asp

7) Music Machines: TB-303/schematics
http://machines.hyperreal.org/manufacturers/Roland/TB-303/schematics/

WOO HOO a hyperreal link :)

Anyone else have interesting 303 trivia?

<3
Karina

Hi Friends, both present and future,
 
I'm sure many of you already know all about this little soiree, but we'd 
love to have as many of you as possible come meet the rest of the family!

<http://california.tribe.net/thread/09f192e3-5abd-41d7-8827-79adfb3a43d1?tribeid=8f684e70-8a70-4f4c-a476-e8130179ef52&threads=true&r=10513#bd4fedd2-ca63-4a18-8bc9-6a0261939c35>
We've about killed ourselves setting this thing up.  We actually have 
PERMITS !! It's shaping up to be epic, and it'd be lovely to see any
or all of your faces there.  It's a benefit, it's not cheap, and that 
kinda sux, but it's for one of our own, and that lessens the sting a 
little. 
 
The lineup is sick, the sound system is the full bore eight stack El 
Circo Bag End affair, and the throb should be massive. 
We are seriously going to shake the place.  And we want you with us!

Check it out and join us, won't you?

Burning Solstinox: Connections  March 5, 2005 8PM-4AM @ SOMArts, 934 
Brannan St in SF
http://www.solstinox.com

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Spirit of Raving Question: Your definition of
  PLUR

--=====================_24143496==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed



I've been avoiding discussions of "raving" on this and some other formerly 
"rave" lists lately.  So early nineties.  Now, after the bust, many with 
calloused fingers, asses and souls have moved beyond emo to cyno :-)  Hell, 
I clicked on my bookmark for bayraves the other day and found it is now 
BRProductions, the #1 Nitelife Network for California.  LOL.

PLUR.  Once something is defined perhaps it sheds significance and power 
much like genres and sub genres of "dance" music.  Everyone I knew in the 
early rave community exemplified these values but folks didn't sit around 
defining the transformative experiences we shared then.  Now it's 
"nightlife" people we are.  That covers lots of territory and I can't say I 
feel connection and brother/sisterhood everywhere in the night.  Lately the 
underground, political hip hop scene gives me spiritual boners and the 
punks, suicide boys and girls and some of the recycled stuff from the 
seventies and eighties may lead to another cultural revolution.  But now we 
have the new PLUR for nightlife peeps:

P =  PRODUCT.  Peace is so sixties eh?  Love same thing.  This is the 21st 
century.  War.  Terror.  The only way we Americans can deal with the dark 
is to consume.  The nitelife party is now a consumable -- ya know, it's IS 
just a party after all.  Many here now produce the product for 
consumption.  The rest of us buy.  Won't touch the stars, but you can have 
fun!!!  Whatever gets you through the night.  And "product" is just so very 
metro, eh?  And it's....yes... APOLITICAL!!!!

L = LUST.  Love is a very dangerous EMOtion.  Got to have 
commitment.  Sacrifice of self.  Empathy.  Guess it was easy to "feel" 
lovey on "E" for some,  but now 'tis alcohol and for many meth.  Guess the 
drug enforcement people are happy about the former and the latter, while so 
very destructive, is more American than a muscle car.
U = UPPITY.  Arrogance and snobbery often characterize the new nitelife 
community.  My genre is better than yours;  my product sells;  only I know 
what good dance music is.  Elitism.  Unity in the community is 
nineties.  We now have our little niches.  Must make direct marketers crazy.

R = RUDE.  All of us have experienced the decline of respect and civility 
in everyday life.  When one's focus is product, lust and snobbery one can 
expect a jab in the ribs on the Dancefloor every so often...at the 
minimum.  That's nitelife as opposed to raving.  Watch for the spiked 
drinks too...that could be an adventure.

Hey.  Nitelife.  It's all good.  All grate.  Lots of fun :-)  And if you 
want more than just a party, well that's up to you isn't it?  Consumer choice.

I'll close with an excerpt of some correspondence I'm having with a 
Croatian EDM lover.  I asked him what the scene was like in Croatia...that 
is nitelife.  I don't  think they have raving yet.  Forgive the English:

"EDM scene in Croatia is maybe at its golden age. Great parties, ( too ) many
DJ's... However, I often see something's missing.
It is probably the "lack of soul" problem that you mentioned in your mail.
Parties are very popular this days - EDM coming from all the possible
sources, kicks hard but vanishes really fast...
There is a huge amount of people coming to the parties not because of music
& dancing but some other, "higher" intereses...( it's very naughty from me
cuz' there was time when those "intereses" pushed me also, but I hope I
pushed them aside now :)
Yes, we had some really good DJ's ( I really enjoyed one night with Farley "
Jackmaster " and ATFC : ), but, I don't know how to express myself, music
gets colder...It starts to be really borring.
I rarely see men dancing ( most of them move their heads while the rest of
the body seems to be nailed to the dancefloor ) unlike women."

Perhaps, if he's lucky, some anarchists will throw a free party under the 
full moon some night soon.

PLUR,

Apollo









Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


The US is:  "...a nation of 200 million used-car salesmen with all the 
money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the 
world who tries to make us uncomfortable."
-Hunter S. Thompson

"Sometime in your life, hope that you might see one starved man, the look 
on his face when the bread finally arrives.  Hope that you might have 
bought it or baked it or even kneaded it yourself.  For that look on his 
face, for your meeting his eyes across a piece of bread, you might be 
willing to lose a lot, or suffer a lot, or die a little, even."
-Daniel Berrigan

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"



--=====================_24143496==.ALT--

L = LUST.  Love is a very dangerous EMOtion.  Got to have commitment. 
Sacrifice of self.  Empathy.  Guess it was easy to "feel" lovey on "E" for

>From the front lines --

It's funny. You know, the kids don't even call it 'rolling' anymore. I 
went to a candy party last weekend, and they called it... 'thizzin'. You 
thizzin dog. You got thizz.

And let me tell you. Those kids were thizzzzzed. Spun out of their minds. 
One kid -- after pestering me and my chums for 'the afterparty' -- told me 
he had been up for two days on the thizz...

We're talking about methamphetamine.

The pills kids are doing now -- I got a couple meth bombs in my day, but 
these things are almost /exclusively/ speed, with a little MDMA or MDA 
thrown in for flavor, along with god knows what else. We're talking the 
shit that has people looking like an asian in the corner of 1015, eyes 
rolling back, twitching. /twitching/.

Subject: [sfraves] SFRaves 13 Year Anniversary Planners Dinner 03.20.05 @ 8PM

SFRaves / Hyperreal.org are not for profit entities, this is a *FREE* 
resource that supports the local community. Our time is given voluntarily, 
Commercial-free, SFRaves loves thee!

http://www.sfraves.org / http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf

This MONTH - March 2005 SFRaves turns 13 YEARS OLD :) (March 1992 -> March 
2005) SFRaves is now a teenager!
Also: SFRaves Calendar is now a decade old :) (March 1995 -> March 2005)

SFRaves & SFRaves-planners are in the process of planning an Anniversary 
Bash to celebrate the 13th year of SFRaves blessing this universe. The 
SFRaves Calendar is also turning 10 this year! In effect, we have double 
the reason to celebrate :)

In order to kick off the event planning SFRaves is hosting a dinner 
(location TBD) to celebrate our presence on this planet as a Free Resource 
to the community, as well to appreciate the SFRaves community presence in 
our lives. This dinner is to be a catalyst in planning the SFRaves 13 Year 
Annniversary Party! Please join us and realize our dreams, an event to 
celebrate our history and contribution to the local scene.

The SFRaves-planners / SFRaves 13 Year Anniversary Dinner is tentatively 
set for Sunday, March 20, 2005 at 8pm. The Location is to be determined 
per the feedback of the list.

The SFRaves-Planners list has risen like a phoenix from the fire, born 
again from its own ashes :)

Please send an email to sfraves-planners-subscribe@hyperreal.org from the 
email you wish to be subscribed from for more information. This list is 
open to those who wish to contribute to the planning of events for SFRaves 
- as well as the 13 Year Anniversary party.

     * To subscribe to SFRaves Planners list, send an email message to:

       sfraves-planners-subscribe@hyperreal.org

SFRaves Calendar - http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2

SFRaves Calendar is now 10 Years Old !!!!!!!!! :)  The calendar is sent 
out by me once per week, this year in November will mark my 7th year of 
administrating the calendar...

Connect with SFRaves Calendar! Free Event Publication, Promotions, Mailing 
List, Event Promotion Resources!

1) Subscribe the SFRaves Calendar Mailing List:

     * To subscribe to SFRaves Calendar list, send an email message to:

       sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

2) Connect with the SFRaves Calendar - FREE Promotions, Group & People 
Profiles, Event Self publication:
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2

3) Register to create an account @
http://hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/add_person_form

4) If applicable, add a Group for your Collective, Production Crew, Label,
Event Promotion, et al:
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/groups/create_group_form

5) Add/Publish and Event to the SFRaves Calendar:
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/add_event_form


SFRaves Discussion List :) If you haven't already - Please Connect with 
the SFRaves Discussion List!

* To subscribe to SFRaves Discussion list, send an email message to:

       sfraves-subscribe@hyperreal.org

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

There's nothing else quite like a Urei 1620. The original rotary fader DJ 
mixer shaped the sounds of almost all the pioneering clubs of the 1970s and 
early '80s, influencing the style of every DJ that followed while helping 
to define dance music culture as we know it today.

http://store.yahoo.com/djgear/soundcrafturei1620le.html





Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


The US is:  "...a nation of 200 million used-car salesmen with all the 
money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the 
world who tries to make us uncomfortable."
-Hunter S. Thompson

"Sometime in your life, hope that you might see one starved man, the look 
on his face when the bread finally arrives.  Hope that you might have 
bought it or baked it or even kneaded it yourself.  For that look on his 
face, for your meeting his eyes across a piece of bread, you might be 
willing to lose a lot, or suffer a lot, or die a little, even."
-Daniel Berrigan

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Folded @ Anu Tonight!

Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hey all, Anu has expanded and the dancefloor is now twice as big, with =
additional sound!  We're back this Friday with the Return of Keyboard =
Mania.  Last time was a blast, hope to see you out once again:

.folded.

1st Fridays @ Anu (43 Sixth St. @ Market)

10PM - 2AM

Never a cover
---

This month features:

Sen-Sei on live keys (turnaround-sound)

RFM on live keys (loquat)

Jonas (sf-vibe)

Origami (newstylesound, pancake, olive, turnaround-sound)

Andrew Phelan (turnaround-sound, olive, thump radio)

---
Stop by early for the Ambient Mafia happy hour from 7-10!

------=_NextPart_000_000F_01C520A2.5E7B8030--

Subject: Re: [sfraves] THE LEGEND IS REBORN

Someday, SOMEDAY, mark my words, I'm going to scrounge up an old Bozak
(the first, and some say best, rotary "dj" mixer) and have it modded to
include some modern features, and HOUSE IT ALL NIGHT LONG!!

hehe :)

There's also a guy in france who makes a shit-hot rotary mixer that is
small enough to fit in your record bag.. I really want one - DJR-400.

love,
GC

--- Apollo <apollo@speakeasy.org> wrote:
> There's nothing else quite like a Urei 1620. The original rotary
> fader DJ 
> mixer shaped the sounds of almost all the pioneering clubs of the
> 1970s and 
> early '80s, influencing the style of every DJ that followed while
> helping 
> to define dance music culture as we know it today.
> 
> http://store.yahoo.com/djgear/soundcrafturei1620le.html
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org
> 
> House Music 101: 
> http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm
> 
> 
> The US is:  "...a nation of 200 million used-car salesmen with all
> the 
> money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in
> the 
> world who tries to make us uncomfortable."
> -Hunter S. Thompson
> 
> "Sometime in your life, hope that you might see one starved man, the
> look 
> on his face when the bread finally arrives.  Hope that you might have
> 
> bought it or baked it or even kneaded it yourself.  For that look on
> his 
> face, for your meeting his eyes across a piece of bread, you might be
> 
> willing to lose a lot, or suffer a lot, or die a little, even."
> -Daniel Berrigan
> 
> "Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of
> the 
> rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually
> become 
> visible."
> -Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"
> 
> 
>

I have to credit our own beloved sninesix (ry.ry) for both the original
concept of "folded" (relating it to origami), and for our "F" logo,
which he drew on a piece of binder paper, scanned, and emailed to me. 
He recently gave me the original at his going-away party.  That was
awesome.

Ryan, we miss you!!

To all the househeads, come out tonight, even if it's wet out.  YOU
DON'T WANNA MISS THIS!

hehe

Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm

Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 19141 invoked from network); 4 Mar 2005 21:04:24 -0000
Message-ID: <20050304210421.68876.qmail@web81406.mail.yahoo.com>
Date: Fri, 4 Mar 2005 13:04:21 -0800 (PST)
From: i'm a idiot <petersandifer@sbcglobal.net>
Reply-To: petersandifer@sbcglobal.net
To: The Twilight Laser Outpost <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Cubik y Origami Airlines (EP review)

Artist:  Cubik & Origami 
EP:  [I won't know the title til I eject the disk]
Wide Hive Records, SF


     This is a confident, pretty, and ethereal (yet grounded) record that lifts off a few miles
north of the Bourbon Street jazz clubs. 

     Our unbearably cute pilots Origami and Cubik make a pit stop in Algeria [track 3] to score
some hash on the way to the next underground chill room [track 4].    Live drums carry a wicked
studio punch that had East Oakland boulevard thugs turning their heads to see whats that noise in
this reporters trunk.   

     Track 5 lands us back on the plains of North America, a plaintive song of some long-lost
warriors, encouraged by stirring battle drums.

   Can an epic run its course in only 5 tracks?  Cubik & Origami do a fine job.  

     Wide Hive Records is a fine label blasting out artists who mesh electronica with live
instruments (DJ Quest, DJ Zeph, Variable Unit and Dissent, for example).   Deserving more credit? 
Yes.  Tearing the roof off this motherfucker?  Yes again.

     Nice job, boys.

     Wide Hive tells me our hometown heroes Cubik & Orgami play every Wednesday in May & June at
Red Devil Lounge, 1695 Polk Street.

     For SFR News, Im Boomerang Fidget.  Peace.

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: A Story About Us - Sundays @ The EndUp

--0-1367936543-1109972737=:23467
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

maybe it's just me, but i remember when i considered the sunday t-dance at the endup the best weekly party in san francisco. super thick vibe, ass-shaking tunes, and at least one of everything you could possibly think of. ravers, professors, trannies, hotties, travellers, whatever... everyone was there and everyone got down. i used to drive out from sacramento on the weekends just to hit up that party, and it was always worth it.
 
now it looks like the EndUp has put something together that can rival those days of community, diversity, and straight-up mayhem on the dance floor. can you tell that i'm excited about it? details are as follows:
 
"A Story About Us"
Sundays in March from 11am - 4pm
Premiers THIS SUNDAY 3/6
<send me an email for guest list!>
 
featuring:
Chris Lum
Naz
Leonard 
Loren
 
The End Up
6th @ Harrison
San Francisco, CA
21+ w/ID
 
~brought to you by abitare music group and in house records~
 
so are you in or what? send me an email for guest list privileges and i'll see you on the dance floor!
 
love,
mo
 
 
 
 


*bliss does not require ignorance*

Celebrate Yahoo!'s 10th Birthday! 
 Yahoo! Netrospective: 100 Moments of the Web 
--0-1367936543-1109972737=:23467--

On Mon, 28 Feb 2005 14:23:03 -0800, Apollo <apollo@speakeasy.org> wrote:
> Is Your Child a Goth? Presented by St. Mary's Church
> 
> Listed below are some warning signs to indicate if your child may have gone
> astray from the Lord. Gothic (or Goth) is a very obscure and often
> dangerous culture that young teenagers are prone to participating in. The
> gothic culture leads young, susceptible minds into an imagined world of
> evil, darkness, and violence. Please seek immediate attention through
> counselling, prayer, and parental guidance to rid your child of Satan's
> temptations if five or more of the following are applicable to your child.
> 
> -Frequently wears black clothing.
> -Wears band and/or rock t-shirts.
> -Wears excessive black eye makeup, lipstick or nail polish.
> -Wears any odd silver jewellery or symbols.
> -Shows an interest in piercings or tattoos.
> -Listens to gothic or any other anti-social genres of music. (Marilyn
> Manson claims to be the anti-Christ, and publicly speaks against the Lord.
> Please discard any such albums IMMEDIATELY.)
> -Associates with other people that dresses acts or speaks eccentrically.
> -Shows a declining interest in wholesome activities, such as: the Bible,
> prayer, church or sports.
> -Shows an increasing interest in death, vampires, magic, the occult,
> witchcraft or anything else that involves Satan.
> -Takes drugs.
> -Drinks alcohol.
> -Is suicidal and/or depressed.
> -Cuts, burns or partakes in any other method of self-mutilation.(This is a
> Satanic ritual that uses pain to detract from the light of God and His
> love. Please seek immediate attention for this at your local mental health
> centre.)
> -Complains of boredom.
> -Sleeps too excessively or too little.
> -Is excessively awake during the night.
> -Demands an unusual amount of privacy.
> -Spends large amounts of time alone.
> -Requests time alone and quietness. (This is so that your child may speak
> to evil sprits through meditation.)
> -Insists on spending time with friends while unaccompanied by an adult.
> -Disregards authority figures; teachers, priests, nuns and elders are but a
> few examples of this.
> -Misbehaves at school.
> -Misbehaves at home.
> -Eats excessively or too little.
> -Eats Goth-related foods. Count Dracula cereal is an example of this.
> -Drinks blood or expresses an interest in drinking blood. (Vampires believe
> this is how to attain Satan. This act is very dangerous and should be
> stopped immediately.)
> -Watches cable television or any other corrupted media sources. (Ask your
> local church for proper programs that your child may watch.) 1
> -Plays videos games that contains violence or role-playing nature.
> -Uses the Internet excessively and frequently makes time for the computer.
> -Makes Satanic symbols and/or violently shakes head to music.
> -Dances to music in a provocative or sexual manner.
> -Expresses an interest in sex.
> -Masturbates.
> -Is homosexual and/or bisexual.
> -Pursues dangerous cult religions. Such include: Satanism,
> Scientology, Philosophy, Paganism, Wicca, Hinduism and Buddhism.
> -Wears pins, stickers or anything else that contains these various phrases:
> "I'm so gothic, I'm dead", "woe is me", "I'm a Goth".
> -Claims to be a Goth.
> 
> If five or more of these apply to your child, please intervene immediately.
> The gothic culture is dangerous and Satan thrives within it. If any of
> these problems persist, enlist your child into your local mental health centre.
> 
> St. Mary's Catholic Church
> LMAO, Texas
> 
> Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

-------------------------------------------

SATURDAY
The Opel 3 Year Event, Infuse: The Divine Mirror
Designed to be an exercise in community synergy and dance floor
tomfoolery

Main Room:
9-10:20       John Schiffer (Grand Champion Sound)
10:20-11:20   Chris Sia (Infinite Kaos / El Circo)
11:20-12:15   Shissla (House of Lotus)
12:15-12:30   Special Ceremony w/ Julia Butterfly Hill
12:30-2:45    Hybrid (DJ Set)
2:45-4:15     Michele Bass (LABA / Mystikal Alchemy)

Side Room:
11-12:10    Hoj (Opel / djhoj.com)
12:30-1:30  Dirtyhertz (Looq / Pangea / Dorigen)
1:30-3:00   Jerry Bonham (Looq / SAW Recordings)
3:00-4:00   Syd Gris (Opel / Opulent Temple)

dedicated chill room, massage, visuals by On the Fly Films,
Lighting by Rockville, performance art and alters by Infinite
Kaos, environemenal awareness tables, art exhibit, and much more!

$15 Pre-sale @ opelproductions.com
511 Harrison @ 1st.
9pm-4am, with OPEN BAR 9pm-10pm

The Divine Mirror is us. When we really see things as they are,
we see the Divinity reflected within us. The infinite space of
emptiness and form co-existing simultaneously. This party will
spread that message, through music, dance, visuals, ceremony,
art, and YOU, the friendly subtle and obvious freaks who
collectively make it happen.

We hope you arrive in time to participate in a special midnight
ceremony with Julia Butterfly Hill. Julia is an activist in
spiritually based social change projects. She got her start
doing a now famous and unprecedented 2 year tree sit atop Luna,
an ancient redwood marked for cutting. Her efforts brought world
wide attention to the unheeded environmental devastation
happening at the time, and helped spark movements to stop it. We
are honored to once again have her as a guest. To maintain a
sacred space, there will be no entry to the party during the
ceremony from 12M-12:15
-------------------------------------------
Burning Solstinox: Connections
8PM-4AM @ SOMArts, 934 Brannan St in SF

Once a year, on the midpoint between burns when we are farthest
in time from any, we come together to celebrate Burning
Solstinox - a holiday of hope, rebirth, love and the creative
thrill of radical participation, when we experience playa joys
in default.

"we 've lined up the area 's best DJ 's, dazzling lighting,
insane lasers, eye-popping visuals, blacklit bars, super cozy
chill spaces, and lots of special playa style amusements sure to
please all your senses"

$15.93 presale;$20 at the door.
For advance tix and info, visit www.solstinox.com
Because some nights are so special they only come once a year...

---------------------------------------------
Groove Garden
DJ Cheb I Sabbah, DJ Dragonfly, DJ Duskis (Six Degrees), Daniel
Berkman (African Kora & electronic percussionTobias), Sword
Swalloing/Sleight of Hand, Snake Dancers, Chai Baba Chai:
Community sit-down dinner @ 6pm: 2398 Sir Francis Drake Blvd
Fairfax (Marin), CA

>From downtempo to house to breaks and bhangra, no continent is
left unturned! 6pm-2am

The US is:  "...a nation of 200 million used-car salesmen with all the 
money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the 
world who tries to make us uncomfortable."
-Hunter S. Thompson

"Sometime in your life, hope that you might see one starved man, the look 
on his face when the bread finally arrives.  Hope that you might have 
bought it or baked it or even kneaded it yourself.  For that look on his 
face, for your meeting his eyes across a piece of bread, you might be 
willing to lose a lot, or suffer a lot, or die a little, even."
-Daniel Berrigan

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

An honest look in the mirror reveals that we have the capacity for great=20
joy and wisdom, and also the capacity for the greatest folly...We have=20
within us incredible kindness, and also the greatest cruelties. We are a=20
species of choices.

This MONTH - March 2005 SFRaves turns 13 YEARS OLD :) (March 1992 -> March=
=20
2005) SFRaves is now a teenager! Also: SFRaves Calendar is now a decade=20
old :) (March 1995 -> March 2005)

SFRaves & SFRaves-planners are in the process of planning an Anniversary=20
Bash to celebrate the 13th year of SFRaves

blessing this universe. The SFRaves Calendar is also turning 10 this year!=
=20
In effect, we have double the reason to

celebrate :)

In order to kick off the event planning SFRaves is hosting a dinner=20
(location TBD) to celebrate our presence on this

planet as a Free Resource to the community, as well to appreciate the=20
SFRaves community presence in our lives. This

dinner is to be a catalyst in planning the SFRaves 13 Year Annniversary=20
Party! Please join us and realize our

dreams, an event to celebrate our history and contribution to the local=20
scene.

The SFRaves-planners / SFRaves 13 Year Anniversary Dinner is tentatively=20
set for Sunday, March 20, 2005 at 8pm. The

Location is to be determined per the feedback of the list.

The SFRaves-Planners list has risen like a phoenix from the fire, born=20
again from its own ashes :)

Please send an email to sfraves-planners-subscribe@hyperreal.org from the=
=20
email you wish to be subscribed from for

more information. This list is open to those who wish to contribute to the=
=20
planning of events for SFRaves - as well

as the 13 Year Anniversary party.

     * To subscribe to SFRaves Planners list, send an email message to:

       sfraves-planners-subscribe@hyperreal.org --

Friday, March 4, 2005 ** Beautiful - A Theatre Party **

Performances:  Friday - March 4th @ 8 PM Saturday - March 5th @ 8 PM=20
Sunday - March 6th @ 7 PM Thursday - March 10th @ 8 PM

=20
theatre world.  Environmental, deconstructionist art with cross dressing,=
=20
corsets, cartoonishly evil fish-head villains, and a lot of leg.  Will you=
=20

shadowy creatures bent on ruining everybody's fun?  The more you dance...

Live theatre, live DJs, and drinks.

non-profit. (www.cellspace.org)=20

Saturday, March 12, 2005 ** Loveworks presents: THE VOODOO PARTY **

Loveworks, the spark that has grown into an intense seven year inferno=20
combining house music, art, and cutting edge atmospherics continues it~Rs=
=20
series of monthly audiosocial experiments by sacrificing you at ~Q THE=20
VOODOO PARTY ~Q on Saturday March 12th ~R05 at their homebase~W the 111=20
Minna Gallery in San Francisco~Rs SOMA District.  This special event will=
=20
be a journey into the mystical, beautiful, tribal and dark sides of dance=
=20
music as well celebration of the triumph and liberation at the end of the=
=20
dance ritual.  In the early part of the evening, the Classics Caf=E9 will=
=20
call forth the sprits of early house and classic soul, then later the main=
=20
floor will feature the savage beats of voodoo house, tribal funk and dark=
=20
dance music.  Loveworks is proud to announce a return visit by former=20
resident DJ and longtime Loveworks family member, DJ and producer PETE=20
AVILA who will be acting as our main master of the ceremony, the witch=20
doctor in charge of body moving on the Loveworks dancefloor.  Commanding=20
the opening ritual for Pete is a Loveworks first-timer JORGE TEREZ (=20
Bar-on-Castro ) sure to cast the power of his musical spellbook on all=20
within his reach.  Last rites will be administered by Loveworks resident=20
dj MATT VALENZ who will be harnessing the healing power of music and=20
unleashing it on the unsuspecting victims, um, we mean, CROWD !  At the=20
door you will encounter a kindler, gentler guardian named JT who will be=20
serving up smiles as well as guest services by the newest member of the=20
door team JONATHAN.  Your hosts for the evening are NORI CASTILLO and=20
DIANNA JACOBS who were instrumental in the creation of the legendary=20
TOONTOWN parties as well as CAREFREE DANCING, the original house party at=
=20
177 Townsend.  Promoboy JIM WILLIAMS will also be on hand to help ease you=
=20
into the groove of the party !  Don~Rt forget to join us early as the=20
Classics Caf=E9 presents a very special event in support of Mikey Kinsley~R=
s=20
AIDS LIFECYCLE BENEFIT.  The Loveworks Classics Caf=E9 is an early evening=
=20
deep dive into the finer aspects of classic house, disco, funk, and soul=20
that truly kicks things off properly at 8pm and gets you ready for the=20
serious body rocking that comes later in the night.  This special evening=
=20
of the Cafe will feature the zombified resurrected beats by none other=20
than our man PHIL SALTER.

BIO: PETE AVILA Pete Avila is one of San Francisco~Rs most legendary DJ~Rs=
=20
and producers, instrumental in the creation of the current dance scene in=
=20
San Francisco.  Starting out DJing for money to help with college in 1984,=
=20
Pete soon found himself taking it all a bit more seriously and started=20
playing other gigs in and around the city, finally settling down for a=20
Friday night residency at Townsend.  Pete would do mutil-houred sets as=20
the sole Dj on Friday nights while Doc Martin would command the club in=20
the same fashion for Saturday nights.  It was at Townsend that Pete began=
=20
learning how to truly forge soundscapes out of the myriad of styles at the=
=20
time, modern rock, early house, latin hip hop.  But the early 90~Rs=20
brought an entirely new phase of excitement to San Francisco~Rs party=20
scene and to Pete Avila in particular.  It was a special, hedonistic time,=
=20
fueled by the use of certain designer drugs, smart drinks, VR, dark=20
dancefloors and even darker chill rooms.  From this spring of creativity=20
was brought forth OSMOSIS, Pete~Rs amazing party at the top floor of the=20
now defunct DV8 club.  For it was at Osmosis that everyone and anyone came=
=20
to party, to dance, to do and be whatever the felt they wanted to.  Since=
=20
Osmosis, Pete has continued to be a mainstay in the Bay Area clubscene,=20
lending his excellent mixing abilities to parties in San Francisco and=20
beyond.  Pete is also a talented producer and remixer, having worked on=20
major projects for Todd Terry, Naked Music, and M-People to name a few.

BIO: JORGE TEREZ Jorge Gutierrez aka DJ Jorge Terez grew up in San=20
Francisco listening to classic disco & funk records played by his older=20
siblings. At the young age of 8, he began collecting vinyl inspired by the=
=20
hip-hop/ break dancing scene. From then on, Jorge's niche was found.=20
Thanks to his older brother, who gave him a gift of 2 Sony turntables,=20
Jorge basically taught himself to mix and scratch." I already had a pretty=
=20
large record collection ranging from disco funk records to new wave/punk=20
records at the time." Throughout high school, he built his DJ reputation=20
by spinning at house parties and also with other local DJs.  In 1987 he=20
began to listen to house records by Todd Terry. By that time, Jorge had=20
been influenced by the Chicago House Scene and decided what he wanted to=20
do for the rest of his life. In 1991 Jorge landed a gig at The Palladium=20
in SF as the opening DJ. Through his Palladium connections, he landed a=20
job at one of San Francisco's biggest radio stations Live 105. He worked=20
various positions eventually working up to production assistant & Mix Show=
=20
producer. In 1997 he defected to San Francisco's urban radio station Wild=
=20
94.9 where he assisted over a year for the Saturday night mix show.=20
Throughout this time, he held down various DJ residencies spinning up to 5=
=20
nights a week at The Sound Factory, Club X, The Box, The Caf=E9, Townsend=
=20
and the infamous PleasureZone parties. Leaving commercial radio in 1999,=20
he was able to focus on the bay area club scene spinning at various clubs=
=20
for various promoters. Wanting to further his career in 2000, Jorge=20
decided to get back behind the scenes and focus on being primarily a dance=
=20
music producer. Currently, he has collaborated with musician Belinda=20
Robles Montoya to produce original soulful house tracks for Bluevelvetcat=
=20
and Deep Vision Records.

DJ influences: all the usual suspects...Frankie Knuckles, Louie Vega,=20
David Harness, Francois K, etc. Bay area dj influences: Miguel Migs, Jay=20
J, Ruben Mancias, and Mind Motion Dj style....."I like to cover the full=20
range of dance music. Ranging From downtempo beat stuff to the soulful=20
house sound even playing the Progressive and break beat stuff. I like it=20
all. As long as it's funky and well produced, I can appreciate it."

Loveworks Resident DJ Bio: MATT VALENZ In a world overtaken by automation=
=20
and technology, soul can be a hard thing to come by.  For someone lucky=20
enough to be raised on the sounds of Earth Wind & Fire, Kool and the Gang,=
=20
Diana Ross, and Tower of Power, being soulful comes as second nature. At=20
17 he was turned onto vinyl and was soon playing Miami bass, freestyle,=20
and primitive house at small underground parties in the central California=
=20
area, then moved on to start a career in the music business when he=20
relocated to San Francisco at age 21.  He continued his drive to learn=20
every aspect of the industry, and returned a few years ago from a two year=
=20
stay in England where he was the booking manager for dy-na-mix agency, the=
=20
best agency for underground music in Europe. Now, back in that city, he is=
=20
resident at ~Q Loveworks Dancing ~Q, a mobile house music phenomenon=20
focusing on vibe, music, and art.  past guests such as Doc Martin, Joi=20
Cardwell, J. Sinister, DJ Diz, and international guests like the UK's=20
Eddie Richards, A Man Called Adam, and Terry Francis have also helped to=20
establish the party as a premier place for true house music, funk, soul,=20
and classics in the bay area.  He continues to play at the some of San=20
Francisco's best parties and is currently assembling a personal studio.

Bio: LOVEWORKS Add a large helping of deep underground house music with a=
=20
side of funk, a heap of disco, and a hint of techno, and you have the most=
=20
nutritious dancefloor experience available in San Francisco. Initially=20
conceived by Dianna Jacobs and Nori Castillo of Toontown / Carefree fame=20
in the summer of '96, Loveworks was envisioned as a refuge from the=20
monotony of local clubs and superficial music, and has become one of the=20
bay area's most well known nights out, while somehow remaining one it's=20
best kept secrets.  It exists to unite people of any race, social status=20
or sexuality together in a comfortable and friendly club environment with=
=20
music as the focal point, and in addition to it's monthly parties at the=20
Minna Gallery, Loveworks also teams up with other like minded parties=20
around the city and has been featured at clubs and parties such as Liquid,=
=20
the Top, Electric, and the Endup.  Besides late night dancing, Loveworks=20
has also been involved in events for Wired Magazine, Apple Computer, Sony=
=20
Digital, Construct Internet Design, and a host of others. Loveworks also=20
had the honor of winning the SF Bay Guardian~Rs ~Q BEST HOUSE CLUB ~Q in=20
1999.


Bio: 111 MINNA GALLERY 111 Minna Gallery is a dynamic ~Qcontemporary art=20
salon~R that provides an arena for multi-dimensional artistic expression=20
in a community atmosphere. The goal of the ~Qgallery-as salon~R concept is=
=20
to nurture and support a communal gathering of artists and a collaboration=
=20
between diverse art forms. This goal is achieved through six-week=20
rotations of visual art exhibitions curated by the staff combined with a=20
variety of music and film events. ~QMinna~R is not only the name of the=20
street on which the gallery is found but also translates from Japanese as=
=20
"everybody," an all-inclusive term that symbolizes the embracing=20
environment of the space. The gallery, which also offers two bars, is=20
crafted in an eclectic, contemporary design with ample furniture inviting=
=20
guests to leisurely relax and enjoy conversation among friends. The=20
combination of art, music, film, dance and conversation found at 111 Minna=
=20
Gallery creates a unique gathering place for a multi-sensory experience.


( contact: Nori for information and guest list questions / 866 841 9139=20
ext 2016 / loveworksdancing@onebox.com.  Check the website at=20
www.loveworksdancing.com )

http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D1935=
=20
San Francisco California, USA

Sunday, March 20, 2005 ** SFRaves Planners 13 Year Anniversary Dinner **

This MONTH - March 2005 SFRaves turns 13 YEARS OLD :) (March 1992 -> March=
=20
2005) SFRaves is now a teenager! Also: SFRaves Calendar is now a decade=20
old :) (March 1995 -> March 2005)

SFRaves & SFRaves-planners are in the process of planning an Anniversary=20
Bash to celebrate the 13th year of SFRaves

blessing this universe. The SFRaves Calendar is also turning 10 this year!=
=20
In effect, we have double the reason to

celebrate :)

In order to kick off the event planning SFRaves is hosting a dinner=20
(location TBD) to celebrate our presence on this

planet as a Free Resource to the community, as well to appreciate the=20
SFRaves community presence in our lives. This

dinner is to be a catalyst in planning the SFRaves 13 Year Annniversary=20
Party! Please join us and realize our

dreams, an event to celebrate our history and contribution to the local=20
scene.

The SFRaves-planners / SFRaves 13 Year Anniversary Dinner is tentatively=20
set for Sunday, March 20, 2005 at 8pm. The

Location is to be determined per the feedback of the list.

The SFRaves-Planners list has risen like a phoenix from the fire, born=20
again from its own ashes :)

Please send an email to sfraves-planners-subscribe@hyperreal.org from the=
=20
email you wish to be subscribed from for

more information. This list is open to those who wish to contribute to the=
=20
planning of events for SFRaves - as well

as the 13 Year Anniversary party.

     * To subscribe to SFRaves Planners list, send an email message to:

       sfraves-planners-subscribe@hyperreal.org=20
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D1944=
=20
San Francisco, CA California, USA

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week.

To subscribe to the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

> > EP:  [I won't know the title til I eject the disk]
> > Wide Hive Records, SF
> >
> >
> >      This is a confident, pretty, and ethereal (yet
> > grounded) record that lifts off a few miles
> > north of the Bourbon Street jazz clubs.
> >
> >      Our unbearably cute pilots Origami and Cubik
> > make a pit stop in Algeria [track 3] to score
> > some hash on the way to the next underground chill
> > room [track 4].    Live drums carry a wicked
> > studio punch that had East Oakland boulevard thugs
> > turning their heads to see what's that noise in
> > this reporter's trunk.
> >
> >      Track 5 lands us back on the plains of North
> > America, a plaintive song of some long-lost
> > warriors, encouraged by stirring battle drums.
> >
> >    Can an epic run its course in only 5 tracks?
> > Cubik & Origami do a fine job.
> >
> >      Wide Hive Records is a fine label blasting out
> > artists who mesh electronica with live
> > instruments (DJ Quest, DJ Zeph, Variable Unit and
> > Dissent, for example).   Deserving more credit?
> > Yes.  Tearing the roof off this motherfucker?  Yes
> > again.
> >
> >      Nice job, boys.
> >
> >      Wide Hive tells me our hometown heroes Cubik &
> > Orgami play every Wednesday in May & June at

I'd love to network with you, chat in pseudo-realtime as well as real 
life. I used to IRC nonstop, though I shall say my days of IRC ways are 
better left to the haze of oldskool daze (ie, I don't run screen sessions 
anymore, botnets, etc - I like to together in real-life. hehe :) The 
rarity of when I am on IRC - you'll find me as user phreaky, anirak, 
karina, nyxxx

Much Love, PLUR & In'Lakesh,

Karina

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

  COME-UNITY 14th BIRTHDAY BASH

 From Malachy:

Hello Come-Unity people,

It has been about a year since the last Come-Unity party,and
much has happened,not all of it in the outside world has been good
news.However,hopefully life is well with you and you are making the
most of your precious life on this sweet earth.

We have a great line-up for March 13th with top-class music
as soon as the doors open($5 before 4.30pm!) and an early special
performance by SLOTMACHINE,so bring the kids.

Inside Main Room
SIMON (Come-Unity/Future Dreams)
JENO (Wicked)
DJ ONIONZ (N.Y.C.)
PETE AVILA (ThriveSF.com)
BONESA
Plus a Special Visitor from L.A.
T.B.A. March 12th

Outside Patio
SLOTMACHINE Live
FELIX the DOG (Groundscore)
TOPH (Red Wine/Pepper)
DJ IVRY (Compression)
JONAH SHARP (Reflective Records).

CAFE COCOMO,650 INDIANA @MARIPOSA,SAN FRANCISCO
$5 before 4.30pm -$15 after



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


The US is:  "...a nation of 200 million used-car salesmen with all the 
money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the 
world who tries to make us uncomfortable."
-Hunter S. Thompson

"Death is our eternal companion.  It is always to our left, at an arm's 
length.  It has always been watching you.  It always will until the day it 
taps you.  The thing to do when you're impatient is...to turn to your left 
and ask advice from death.  An immense amount of pettiness is dropped if 
your death makes a gesture to you, or if you catch a glimpse of it, or if 
you just catch the feeling that your companion is there watching you."
-Carlos Castaneda

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"



--=====================_43817906==.ALT--

January 22 - April 3, 2005
Yerba Buena Center for the Arts
San Francisco, California

Performance:

March 6, 2005
San Francisco, California
In association with the january 22- April 3 exhibition at the Yerba
Buena Center for the Arts
A public performance of a large beach drawing.
The drawing will take place below the Cliff House at the far north end
of Ocean Beach.
beginning... 11 am ... finish 4: 00 ... Destruction 4: 20...

near the center, from the nearby elevated walkway or from high atop
the cliff at Sutro park.

The US is:  "...a nation of 200 million used-car salesmen with all the 
money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the 
world who tries to make us uncomfortable."
-Hunter S. Thompson

"Death is our eternal companion.  It is always to our left, at an arm's 
length.  It has always been watching you.  It always will until the day it 
taps you.  The thing to do when you're impatient is...to turn to your left 
and ask advice from death.  An immense amount of pettiness is dropped if 
your death makes a gesture to you, or if you catch a glimpse of it, or if 
you just catch the feeling that your companion is there watching you."
-Carlos Castaneda

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Subject: [sfraves] So like lastnight... American Shield, Anu, & Blue Cube

Wow... OK.. so went 2 this almost Family get 2gehter like afternoon 2
evening potluck thingie & well.. I made cookies from Scratch.. I call them
my Peanut Butter Chocolate Candy cookie....  I did my usual a la peanut
bitter baking goods in cookie form... but I had like all these mini mnm's
from school I got the night b4 & added crushed up milk chocolate bits &
white chocolate bits!!  Wow.. I actually got full from Chel'c's yummy
Tempura Vegtables.. oooh.. so good.. & other vegaterian stuff & I was
full...  I mean.. I was like totally like tryin' 2 save my tummy 4 some
Pasta Gumbo, but.. so full from all the Veggie Yummies!!!

Then I went 2 American Shield 2 hopefully hang out w/ Mr Megatron.. but we
(me & Mc Child, which ironically we bumped in2 each other as soon as i got
2 the last step of the street level from the bart station) got there early
& kicked it w/ SubTek & got alota 2Step talkin w/ him.. the DJ spinning, I
4got his name.. this tall dude... started out the night w/ Dancehall...
YUM!  child got on the Mic & spit 4 a bit... Nice!!!  YAY!!  OK.. i do
have 2 say.. the 1 Urinal in the guys bathroom is Awesome!!!  I mean..
it's like this HUGE, 1 person, Urinal.. so Dope!!!

Then him & I cut out 2 Anu where he rocked on the Mic again & oh yeah..
had a lota interesting conversation on the walk there... but yeah.. I
dunno.. some guy was on the decks doin' the opening slot... DJ Long &
Smooth, Shiney finess or soemthing... LoL... Fuck man... Child's Dope on
the Mic & he doesn't do the naselly talk when he MCs... Dope!! YAY!!

After 1/2 an hour or so, i went 2 Blue Cube 4 the Clandestine Shindig...
OH shit.. OK.. Bam.. I gotta tell U.. THANK U SOOO MUCH 4 PRINCE... sorry
I got 2 the dance floor late.. I was chillin' in the girls Bathroom...
OK.. but yeah.. I Looooooooooooooooved all the music i heard that night!! 
I mean.. I totally grabbed hella floor lastnight!!  WOW!!  It was So
Dope!!  Lastnight was really special also 4 several reasons as well.. 1st
reason being that I finally Saw Robin aka DJ Kryptyk after like 2 years...
yeah... my Jungle Big Bro is back in town & he warned me never to go 2 his
old hood in Alabama 'cause (in his words) "it's so white there dude you'll
scare everyone if U ever show up".... LMAO

OK.. Music... WOW!!!  I mean... I really wish i could go in 2 like mondo
detail about each set.. oh yeah.. well... OK.. Bam really got me when he
played 1 of my songs!!  YAY!  But man... all the breakbeat DJs really oh
man... all the Jungle DJs realy got me also man!!  Good shit... it was
like being caught in between 2 incrdible sins 'cause it was just hard 2
decide what room i wanted 2 dance in!!  I do really have 2 say that 2 of
my fave Jungle sets of the night was Genome... they really brought it
hard, bouncy,
& really ummm... I dunno.. i just Loved their sets the best!  I Loved all
the sets upstairs @ Blue Cube.... YUM!!

I do have 2 say that all the Break Beat sets were Dope.. the 2nd DJ, I
4got her name, was Dope... but IMO.. Bam & Aaron Jae brought it up in that
room.... Bam's set was Sick... he brought like all these mondo diff 2/4
beats 2gether in dance musical stew that had me on the floor just uuuh..
Loved it!!  Aaron Jae totally brought up the energy more w/ his set of
Future Breakbeats... oooh WOW!!  I Loved it!

Blue Cube is a Dope lil' spot!!  This was my 2nd time there & Wow... it
was Dope!!  Fucki'n A man... I was just in Hevean!!  The energy of the
party was Sick... alota people were there, Family all around, it was
amazing!!  The whole fuckin' night was Amazing 'cause lately I been
revonnecting w/ old skool Bro's (MC Child & Kryptyk) & LoL.. Hello 2day..
I'm just fuckin' smittin' like crazy man 'cause yeah.. it was just a So
Dope night!!  Hung out w/ alota just Groovy people lastnight...

Then my Homie Anthony told me that like since I didn't know how or what I
was gonna do (getting back home 2 Hercules or chillin' on the sofa @
some1's pad after Candestine), so he told me 2 tag along w/ him 2 this
Underwear afterparty... so around 2 we left 2 go & I'm all buggin' ;'cause
I never been 2 1 of these shindigs b4... we got there, & it turned out it
was invite only la la la la... so after hangin' out @ this Dude's
apartment in the Richmond on top of a Sushi resturaunt, we got back 2 the
Cube & luckily I got a ride back 2 Hercules!!  YAY!!

OK... LoL... it was a Groovy Sat night!!  If I saw U... Dope.. if not..
I"ll see U sometime soon on a dance floor somewhere w/in reach of BART,
Muni, walking, Cal Train, Westcat, or AC Transit!!!

Good Stuff!!!  YAY =)

Subject: [sfraves] Open Invitation to Join sfraves-planners :)

again from its own ashes :)

Please send an email to sfraves-planners-subscribe@hyperreal.org from the

open to those who wish to contribute to the planning of events for SFRaves 
- as well as the 13 Year Anniversary party.

******************>karina@hyperreal.org<**********************
If there is a sin against life, it consists perhaps not so
much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life
& in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
-- Albert Camus -- *******************************************

The US is:  "...a nation of 200 million used-car salesmen with all the 
money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the 
world who tries to make us uncomfortable."
-Hunter S. Thompson

"Death is our eternal companion.  It is always to our left, at an arm's 
length.  It has always been watching you.  It always will until the day it 
taps you.  The thing to do when you're impatient is...to turn to your left 
and ask advice from death.  An immense amount of pettiness is dropped if 
your death makes a gesture to you, or if you catch a glimpse of it, or if 
you just catch the feeling that your companion is there watching you."
-Carlos Castaneda

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Hi All-

Fyi, I just removed the delay on new subscriber's posts (an anti-spam 
measure put in when we were being harrased a while back, remember that 
dude?)

So the list is back to its normal state, anyone can subscribe and post as 
they please. Although currently, there is a 25 per post day limit, and 
maximum 7 recipient cross-post limit.

Apologies to anyone who's posts took forever to get through or otherwise 
didn't get through. We should be all good now =)

take care,
-terry

The US is:  "...a nation of 200 million used-car salesmen with all the 
money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the 
world who tries to make us uncomfortable."
-Hunter S. Thompson

"Death is our eternal companion.  It is always to our left, at an arm's 
length.  It has always been watching you.  It always will until the day it 
taps you.  The thing to do when you're impatient is...to turn to your left 
and ask advice from death.  An immense amount of pettiness is dropped if 
your death makes a gesture to you, or if you catch a glimpse of it, or if 
you just catch the feeling that your companion is there watching you."
-Carlos Castaneda

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"
