X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Moontribe Lastnight.. Oh yeah!

I just realized I haven't done a review in 2 years, so here goes.

This was the first time I've ever gone to 1015, so I didn't really
have any expectations for the party one way or another. The last 2
years in Arizona have really burned me out, and have actually made it
very not fun for me to go out anymore.

Anyhow, enough bitching..

So I walked up to 1015 with osby around 9:45, waited outside for about
20 minutes with Russ and this very humorous slightly inebriated girl
whom I guess is a friend of mike's also. Her name eludes met though.
So up comes about 10:05 or so and they begin to let us in. Osby had
gone to all this trouble to get me on guestlist, and then I wouldn't
have even needed it that night.

So I finally get inside a little Mike starts spinning. To be honest, I
was enjoying the music, but the vibe just wasn't there at first. I
wasn't having a good time. Plus, I don't recall EVER paying 10 dollars
a shot for alcohol. Honestly, my butt hurt after that one. bought 2
shots, and 2 beers right off the bat. 30 bucks.

So I was standing around, taking up space on the dancefloor, talking
to becca and others, being incredibly dorky, but didn't dance much. I
don't make for that great of a dancer while I'm un-drunk. In fact,
it's very difficult for me to dance while un-drunk, since I'm paranoid
of my white-boy syndrome. As I'm just chillin, I run into at least 15
people that I used to know.

So after mike's set, and his attempted sexual assault on the
dancefloor, I walked around for a while and checked out the other
rooms with Stacey. Ended up hanging out with her a majority of the
night.

Finally met Danny Picard. Been talking to him for years.  That was
pretty groovy.

Anyhow, finally got out of there around 6ish in the morning or so (I
think). Funniest part was getting a ride the whole block and a half
back to G's place. I think the car was actually farther away than
George's place was from the club. Can't complain though. Great
company, and great people to hang out with.

I'm sorry if I wasn't able to say goodbye to most people. As most of
my friends had left by that time in the night. It was pretty cool
though, at least talking to all my old friends.

Kinda nice not being banished to the desert anymore though. :)

-- 
Live Life at 140bpm

---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  Former republican finds some principles...

http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/n/a/2005/03/14/state/n162642S50.DTL

Not only was he a republican, but also a catholic, and an appointee of Pete
"How I hate the hispanic community, let me count the 187 ways." Wilson!!! (/Me/
chuckles with glee at our bitch-ass, evil-bigot governor and the rest of his
little fundie hatemongering buddies.)

It won't stand, of course. Our supreme court took their own stand with the
forces of hate last year, when they backed up the governor in his anti-gay
campaign. So there's little doubt how they'll rule when the neocons inevitably
appeal.

But still, to see a (ex-, I suppose... now...)republican, catholic,
Wilson-appointee turn over to the side of justice and equality... it shows that
the wheels of progress ARE turning, however slowly.

Too bad you can't recognize conservatives on sight. I'd love to find one
tomorrow, break out my best (not very good though, actually) Nelson Muntz
voice, shout "HaHaaa!!!" and laugh hysterically in its face.

So.... uh.... yeah.... With further apologies to Matt Groening: WooHoo!!!!


cya,
john

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Request for QA Roles - Open Source, Full-Time, Contract,
 Freelance opportunities 

Pardon the intrusion, as much as I have been and will always be devoted to my 
volunteer / not for profit pursuits, my careerpath is QA.

I'm seeking interesting Full Time, Contract, Consulting/Freelance Opportunities 
*and* Open Source Projects that are looking for a QA engineer with a solid 
background and diverse technical skillset. I've been in Software / Hardware 
Quality Assurance for 12+ years and am seeking projects to contribute towards 
the quality of the Gnu Public license and/or any Open Source model. I also am 
interested in Full-time employment, contract/consulting roles, as well as 
part-time/freelance work on any projects that seek a stellar QA engineer. If 
you know of someone who needs help or is looking for a tester with a technical 
edge, please feel free to refer them to me.

Roles: Full-time employment, contract, freelance, W2 opportunities in the QA 
field.

Objective: Senior QA Engineer, Lead Quality Assurance Engineer or QA Manager 
role
Summary & Qualifications: 12 years experience in Hardware/Software QA 
Engineering
- 6 years experience managing Quality Assurance organizations, leading multiple 
QA engineers and projects.
- 8 years experience in a Product Support and Technical Support Engineering 
role.
- 12 years experience in a Senior QA Engineer and Lead QA Engineer role.
- 12 years experience establishing various QA processes and procedures 
including: Product Development and Software LifeCycle, the QA Lifecycle 
process, Defect Submittal, Reporting, Tracking and Escalation Lifecycle, 
Product Validation, Certification and Release Lifecycle, QA Project Planning 
and QA Test Methodologies and Processes.
- 12 Years planning and executing Test Plans as part of the design, development 
and QA cycle of various projects.
- 12 years experience authoring and conducting Acceptance, Ad-Hoc, Black Box 
(Behavioral, Functional, Closed Box, Opaque box), GUI, Functional, Integration, 
Installation, Manual, Navigation, Module and Regression Tests.
- 11 Years performing release certification and validation, Unit and 
Integration Checks, Source Code Management.
- 10 years conducting White Box tests (Structural, Glassbox, Clearbox, System 
Internals, Branch/Path Coverage Tests).
- 12 years authoring and executing Performance, Database, Security, 
Smokescreen, Stress, Boundary, Load, Validation, SW & HW Compatibility Tests 
using advanced and innovative Test Methodologies in Macintosh, Windows, Unix, 
WAP, WML, Console game systems and Palm OS environments.
- 12 years authoring, documenting and defining standards for QA (Test Plans, 
Test Cases, Test Scripts and Test Procedures).
- 7 years experience administrating QA Lab Operations (Network/Test/Lab 
Environment), QA Release Cycle and QA Intranet website. Functions of this 
capacity included: QA Website Webmaster, QA Lab Administrator, QA Production 
Lab Administrator, QA Release certification and Defect Tracking Systems 
Administrator.

Resume and extensive references furnished upon request

Thank you for your time. In'Lakech - I am You, and You are me.

(Yucatec Maya)
"ONLY MAY THERE BE PEACE IN YOUR PRESENCE"

Zigmund Void.

>=20


--=20
Main Entry: 1ta=B7la=20
Pronunciation: 't=E4-l&
Function: noun
Etymology: Sanskrit tAla, literally, hand-clapping
: one of the ancient traditional rhythmic patterns of Indian music --
compare RAGA

Subject: [sfraves] Oh Yeah...  FruitCocktail 2 last Sat Night


So yeah... Sat night I went 2 FriutCocktail 4 some candy fun 'cause
well... it's been a while & I miss my Fam in CandyLand...

Anywazys, JonnyR picked me up & it was Dope 'cause like we haven't hung
out in like a loooong time!!!  YAY!

It was Dope... 'cause liek I dunno... well.. I do know.. it was nice
seein' like hella people I ain't seenin 4ever & Wow... OK... 1 of the 1st
sets I was Diggin' was umm... oh gosh.. James something who was spinning
this like 80's set.. James Dub???  Hmmm.. but Loved it!!! Loved It Loved
it!!!  OH Man... did i tell U I Loved that set???!!!

Another Set I Loved alot was Secondbase!!  Ooooh Yuuuuum.. HARDCORE!!! 
Nuf said about that!!  But yeah... YUM!!!

David Bu Hau spin this yummy set also... OK... I do remember alota nummy
breakbeats (almost psy breaks I think) & I dunno... did i hear some trance
in there also... I Loved it!!!

Speaking up... DragnflyMama was there... YAY!!  Loved her ok.. I always
get ass smacks 4 sayin' this wrong so 4 safetly sake, I"m gonna say she
spun this really Dope 4 On Da Floor, "Hard Dance" set... LMAO... all i
know is that I was DMAO during this set, as w/ all the sets I Loved &
mentioned so far, & mmmmm.... well.. when i wasn't dancing, I stole her
camera & took ass shots of Dfly... Hmmm.. wonder if she knows I thook
those pictures???  D???  LMAO

OK... Aaron Jae tore itup on the Future Breaks set that set the whole
venue on FIRE!!!  Well.. it get's hot in the dungeon.. have 2 blame
somebody!

The night was fun there.. really!!  Geetin' 2 hang out w/ every1 I ain't
see in a long time was Dope!!! Decroations was kinda minimal & ya know..
the dope thing about Fruitcocktail 2 was that the line looked like there
was only 2 rooms like when u saw the line up 4 the the shindig.. but it
endedup being like 2 hr sets from aaaaaaaaaall the DJs & 3 DJs per room!! 
So that was fun!  Oh man.. Loved it!!!

What hella touch me was that i saw Kristoff 4 like the 1st time in like 2
years!!!  Wow!!  That was neat!!  We talked alot the whole night.. he
useed 2 B here on SFR if any1 remembers him....  Yeah man... LoL...

All in all, it was a Groovy night... keep your ears open 4 another
Fruitcocktail 2 come!!!  Serously man... good fucki' times @ these
FruitCocktail events!!!  YAY

have them send their resume to: matt@nr10.com

4 Freelance PHP/MySQL development roles: Short Term Contract (2 month)

Company: 	NR10
Rate: 	$30.00/hour
Type: 	Full Time
City: 	San Francisco
NR10 is searching for up to 4 PHP/MySQL developers to work on a short term 
(2 month), web-based custom application development project starting in 
April. You will work on-site (negotiable) and you must live in the SF Bay 
Area (preferrably in SF). Must have at least 2 years of full-time 
experience working with PHP/MySQL/HTML. Please send resume, links and rate 
information. We are looking to make a decision very quickly, so please 
respond asap if you are interested. No offshore inquiries please. Salary 
range for position is $10 USD - $50 USD per hour. Send resumes to: 
tinyurl.com/585av
Company URL: www.nr10.com

the URL above for all inquiries. Thank you.

Hey all, Mr. George Origami and I just finished up our promo mix for =
Winter Music Conference, it's all original tracks by us and includes =
music from our upcoming releases on newstylesound, So Sound, and =
Turnaround-Sound (we like labels with teh word sound in them).  George =
is a f'n studio/music wizard if you didn't know, I've learned a ton from =
him in the last year + and this mix is the best of the stuff we've done =
in that span.  So if you like your house funky like funkay then take a =
listen:

http://www.djandrewphelan.com/music/Andrew_Phelan_and_Origami_MixedProduc=
tionSampler1.mp3

My other past mixes are here if anyone cares:

http://www.djandrewphelan.com/mixes.php

-Andrew

Subject: [sfraves] Looking for a roommate in Santa Rosa

------=_NextPart_000_001E_01C5299B.81789440
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Sorry this is a bit off topic.
Avaliable 4/1
I am looking for a roommate to share a two bedroom apartment in
downtown. The apartment is in a small garden complex between the
fairgrounds and Sonoma on Brookwood. 
There is a 500 dollar security deposit. The rent includes water and
garbage. PG&E generally runs between 20 and 40 dollars (your half) and
if you want to use it there is wireless DSL which would be 17 dollars a
month. 
Common areas have some furniture already, but I would be open to
additions that fit with the current decor. 

I am looking for someone who will not have any problem keeping common
areas neat and clean, also someone who is respectful of others. 

If this sounds like a place you would be intrested in please reply to
this posting with a little information about yourself as well as the
best way and times to contact you. 

Thanks 
Candi

Subject: [sfraves] ACID TEST: Doc Martin Jeno Garth 4-22

 ACID TEST reproduced by Acid Totem

Friday, April 22, 2005 @ Club Mighty SF

DOC MARTIN (sublevel)

GARTH (wicked, grayhound)

JENO (wicked, whoosh!)

Ben Haus vs Dave L (acid totem)

10pm-4am
21+
$5 b4 11pm
$15 thereafter

Presale tickets available at www.mighty119.com

DRESS The Way YOU Are~

www.mission-1.net
415 267-6172


1965, Ken Kesey, author of "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest", and his band
of Merry Pranksters stage the first Acid Test; a radical and psychedelic
experiment based around music and lighting projections in Santa Cruz County.
Many Acid Tests would follow the Soquel Acid Test, and would prove to be a
major catalyst of things to come in the counter-culture revolution of the
1960's. Circa 25 years later, a different revolution was occuring on the
Beaches and in the Deserts of California. Under the watch of the full moon,
DJ's such as Doc Martin, and Garth and Jeno of the Wicked Crew introduced
House and Electronic music to thousands, and would lay the foundation for
the West Coast Sound for the next decade plus.

Join us as we celebrate all that is positive with the Old, the New, and
everything in between. Re-experience the pure and virgin energy that helped
create and build our House Nation.


Stay tuned for Free Outdoor parties in the weeks before and after Acid Test

http://www.mission-1.net/images/webflyer.gif

---------------------------------------------------------------------

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: Re: [sfraves] New mix from Origami & Andrew Phelan

Andrew is too kind- he did a *GREAT* deal of work on these tracks, from
sample searchin' to scads arranging, tons of editing, and keeping
things dj friendly.  Without him, this stuff would sound, well, like
all the other Origami house stuff. :)  He is fast becoming a studio
whiz and these tracks show that off.

Just wanted to set dee record straight! :)

-george cochrane | origami
-newstylesound recordings
-newstylesound.com

>From: Acid Totem <acidtotem@gmail.com>
>Reply-To: Acid Totem <acidtotem@gmail.com>
>To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
>Subject: [sfraves] ACID TEST: Doc Martin Jeno Garth 4-22
>Date: Wed, 16 Mar 2005 08:20:21 -0800
>
>  ACID TEST reproduced by Acid Totem
>
>Friday, April 22, 2005 @ Club Mighty SF
>
>DOC MARTIN (sublevel)
>
>GARTH (wicked, grayhound)
>
>JENO (wicked, whoosh!)
>
>Ben Haus vs Dave L (acid totem)
>
>10pm-4am
>21+
>$5 b4 11pm
>$15 thereafter
>
>Presale tickets available at www.mighty119.com
>
>DRESS The Way YOU Are~
>
>www.mission-1.net
>415 267-6172
>
>
>1965, Ken Kesey, author of "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest", and his band
>of Merry Pranksters stage the first Acid Test; a radical and psychedelic
>experiment based around music and lighting projections in Santa Cruz 
>County.
>Many Acid Tests would follow the Soquel Acid Test, and would prove to be a
>major catalyst of things to come in the counter-culture revolution of the
>1960's. Circa 25 years later, a different revolution was occuring on the
>Beaches and in the Deserts of California. Under the watch of the full moon,
>DJ's such as Doc Martin, and Garth and Jeno of the Wicked Crew introduced
>House and Electronic music to thousands, and would lay the foundation for
>the West Coast Sound for the next decade plus.
>
>Join us as we celebrate all that is positive with the Old, the New, and
>everything in between. Re-experience the pure and virgin energy that helped
>create and build our House Nation.
>
>
>Stay tuned for Free Outdoor parties in the weeks before and after Acid Test
>
>http://www.mission-1.net/images/webflyer.gif
>

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] $10 list for Evil Breaks Anniversary - this saturday!!!

ok, our $10 online tickets are gone!  presales are now $15 in stores
and online.  door tickets are going to be $20!

however, i'm going to hook up my SFR friends with the $10 list!  but
just to make it fun, you'll have to correctly answer one of the
following questions.  all questions refer to something i've posted on
this list in years past.  first 3 people that answer one of them
correctly gets in for $10!

1)  where did i pass out drunk after my first ever experience playing
in front of a crowd?  or, what did i wake up wearing?  hint:  it was
at a house party in april 2002 in berkeley at a co-op.  i got
absolutely tanked and don't remember most of the evening.

 2)  my first time playing at a club/bar was at a party Summer 2002
that i threw with my friends Moshen and Tim (both from SFR).  what was
the party called or where was it at?  or, name another DJ that played
that night.

3)  where did i first meet Osby?

ready, set, go!

> Evil Breaks One Year Anniversary
> Saturday, March 19th
> 9pm-4am
> @ 330 Ritch, SF
> 
> Featuring:
> General Midi - (TCR/Kilowatt/Distinctive) - UK
> Roxiller Live - Chris Carter & JHz (TCR/Record Records/Sober) - UK
> 
> Special guest-
> Corey Edwin (IAG/Sober) - Miami
> 
> Plus all the Evil Breaks residents:
> 
> Aaron Jae (Evil Breaks/AaronJae.com)
> DJ Bam (Evil Breaks/Invibe.com)
> M.O.D. (Evil Breaks)
> Influence (Evil Breaks/nfluence.net)
> Athena (Evil Breaks) Tahoe, CA
> Nick Nyquil (Evil Breaks/Ill Behavior)
> 
> Lasers and Lighting provided by Stimulights with Ice Sculpture and
> Culinary art by Chef Jauncy.
> 
> $15 presales @ www.Groovetickets.com, Reverb(sf), and Skills(berkeley)
> $20 at the door the night of the event.
> 
> This show is guaranteed to sell out, so to make sure you've got a
> place at the party, please buy your presales now.
> 
> www.evilbreaks.com
--

Subject: [sfraves] mothers cookies?

um...is this what i think it is???

http://www.craigslist.org/eby/apa/64087147.html

$1850 - **Old Mother's Cookies Live Work Space near Lake Merit** 
(oakland lake merritt / grand)
Reply to: see below
Date: 2005-03-16, 1:44PM PST

Live/Work Spaces, Recently Renovated in a Historic Oakland Building

The breakdown for the unit currently available is as follows:

Available Now #13 1,620 square feet for $1,850 per month, off street
parking for an extra $50 per month. The unit available is suitable for
an individual or a couple. It is all opened space which does not make
it condusive to people not in a relationship.

This beautiful Red Brick building on E 18th Street was the home of
Mother Cookies from 1922 to 1947. It has now been converted into Live
Work Spaces. The building is in a great location with a very feindly
neighborhood. Just a 15 minute walk to Lake Merit. A short bike ride
to Lake Merit or 12th Street BART. The unit currently available has a
large cement floored downstairs workspace. The upstairs has the
original 1922 maple hardwood floors, which have been refinished. The
units has new kitchen & bathroom. A lot of light from skylights in all
of the units. Garbage, water, CAM (Common Area Maintenance) fees are
included in the rent. Security deposit is equivalent to one months
rent.

This unit is ideal if you are looking for a space to run your small
business & live in the same location. If you would like to attend a
showing of this unit please call 510-550-7475 to schedule an
appointment. If you do attend a showing please be on time. You can
also learn more about the building by visiting this web site to veiw
pictures http://www.gmbrealty.com/omclofts
--

Subject: [sfraves] anyone handy with a camera?

anyone handy with a camera and who has a good digital camera that can
shoot in a variety of lighting situations that is either a photo
hobbyist or who takes photos on some kind of regular basis?  anything
from portraits to action shots to candid shots to nightlife?

and if this is you...would you be interested in donating your services
for this saturday night?  you'd get free entrance to the Evil Breaks
one year, but you'd have to commit to taking photos for most of the
event.

hit me back off list!

Connect with SFRaves Calendar! Free Event Publication, Promotions, Mailing=
=20
List, Event Promotion Resources!

1) Subscribe the SFRaves Calendar Mailing List:

     * To subscribe to SFRaves Calendar list, send an email message to:

       sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

2) Connect with the SFRaves Calendar - FREE Promotions, Group & People=20
Profiles, Event Self publication:
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2

3) Register to create an account @
http://hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/add_person_form

4) If applicable, add a Group for your Collective, Production Crew, Label,
Event Promotion, et al:
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/groups/create_group_form

5) Add/Publish and Event to the SFRaves Calendar:
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/add_event_form

Subject: [sfraves] Invitation to Join SFRaves Planners 

Reminder Invite:

SFRaves / Hyperreal.org are not for profit entities, this is a *FREE* resource 
that supports the local community. Our time is given voluntarily, 
Commercial-free, SFRaves loves thee!

http://www.sfraves.org / http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf

This MONTH - March 2005 SFRaves turns 13 YEARS OLD :) (March 1992 -> March 
2005) SFRaves is now a teenager!
Also: SFRaves Calendar is now a decade old :) (March 1995 -> March 2005)

SFRaves & SFRaves-planners are in the process of planning an Anniversary Bash 
to celebrate the 13th year of SFRaves blessing this universe. The SFRaves 
Calendar is also turning 10 this year! In effect, we have double the reason to
celebrate :)

We would like to invite you to join SFRaves Planners - a group of SFRaves 
Family / Community members who are gathering the tribes, individuals and 
resources to reach out to the community and plan events / colloborate with 
other crews, collectives, djs, producers, record labels, etc to coordinate and 
plan events with SFRaves.

sfravesplanners.tribe.net

The SFRaves-Planners list is up and running. To subscribe,
Please send an email to

sfraves-planners-subscribe@hyperreal.org

from the email you wish to be subscribed from for more information. This list 
is open to those who wish to contribute to the planning of events for SFRaves 
- as well as the 13 Year Anniversary party.

Again -

* To subscribe to SFRaves Planners list, send an email message to:

sfraves-planners-subscribe@hyperreal.org

<3 Karina and SFRP

Subject: [sfraves] Re: $10 list for Evil Breaks Anniversary - this saturday!!!

well ok, fuck.  those questions were way too random.

first 3 people who email me back get in to the party for $10.

fyi, the answers to the following questions were:

> 1)  where did i pass out drunk after my first ever experience playing
> in front of a crowd?  or, what did i wake up wearing? 

i passed out ON TOP of the turntables.  my friend has a photo of this.
 i woke up in my bed wearing a tshirt and socks.

> 
>  2)  my first time playing at a club/bar was at a party Summer 2002
> that i threw with my friends Moshen and Tim (both from SFR).  what was
> the party called or where was it at?  or, name another DJ that played
> that night.

it was called Retrograde and was held at Amnesia.  the other DJs that
night were Ms. Throwdown, Konkers and GBA.

> 3)  where did i first meet Osby?

on the steps of City Hall at the Unity party.

Subject: [sfraves] Steroid use in MLB and The RAVE Act II

This is just a rough draft of an idea that i just posted to the local
DC Craig's List BB, that I feel has some merit for us in Rave
community.

If this Congress insists on pursuing this course about steroid use I
feel it's only fair to remind them that they've already passed a Law
regarding this and they might want to start enforcing it.

Anyhow, like I said, this is just a rough draft, but i'd like to
nurture & amplify it a bit and if anyone's got any suggestions as to
how to do that, beside's not giving my LaTourrette's Syndrome full
fucking fly, I know that one, I'd really appreciate the help.

Here's the link, which expires in 30 days or so:

http://washingtondc.craigslist.org/rnr/64228387.html

thanks!

DC Craig's List BB, that I feel has some merit for us in Rave
community.

regarding this and they might want to start enforcing it.

nurture & amplify it a bit and if anyone's got any suggestions as to
how to do that, beside's not giving my LaTourrette's Syndrome full
fucking fly, I know that one, I'd really appreciate the help.

thanks!

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Steroid use in MLB and The RAVE Act II

Hey thanks Steve.

Lead with the original Craigslist post, if you don't mind, 

http://washingtondc.craigslist.org/rnr/64228387.html .

Be interesting if this got some traction and George Steinbrenner or
Peter Magowan or Steve Schott were staring at doing some serious
Federale time.

Can't you just see it?

Certainly would make the average overfed and overdressed, Red State,
red meat eating, sport fan's head spin, wouldn't it?

How much do you want to bet the Law would then be challenged on
grounds of being Unconstitutional?

I just left a very polite VM on Senator Joe Biden's office just now,
asking as politely as possible why it is that neither he, nor anyone
else up on The Hill, has picked up on how applicable the RAVE Act is
to this issue.

I left it at that i will be calling back for an answer and will be
asking this question to everyone I know.

I just got up from a nap and the hearing itself just broke up. Damn.
Bet Mark McGwire is feeling more drained right now then when he hit
70.

I halfway considered going up there today to present this idea to
people, F2F, 1-on-1, but I figured my time was better spent on the
internets with this, since I can't fucking abide these corrupt
rat-bastids.

Be nice if the idea were to get out of the forums and enter the
Blogo-sphere as well.

have a great day.

nwa

"Jesus died for somebody's Sins, but not mine."
Patti Smith, Gloria, Horses, Arista Records, (c) 1975

'I love it when a plan comes together.'
Col. John "Hannibal" Smith, The A-Team

"Planning is absolutely essentail and absolutely useless."
General Dwight D. Eisenhower

"One thing I'm certain of, there's too much certainty in this world'
Michael Crichton, Author's Note, "State of Fear" (c) 2004

"Flush out your head-gear, New Guy.
You think we waste gooks for
"Democracy?"
Don't kid yourself.
This is a slaughter.
If I'm gonna get my balls shot off  for a word....
I get to pick my own word....
My word is:
"Poontang."

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Happy Birthday Brian Behlendorf & SFRaves / SFRCal (in advance)!

umm, and let us not forget the role Brian had in birthing, oh, say..... 

Apache. 

without which *none* of us would even be having *any* of this blessed
conversation on the internets.

picture this.....

no listservs, googles, yahoos, streaming porns, p2p-mp3s, flash, sql,
live blogging, emailsies, well no, wait that might still exist in
crappy command line, non-html, pine mode, the list is endlesss......

none of it.

we'd all be in the dark, in a cold, sleeting rain, banging two rocks
together, hoping to get a spark, to light a fire, just so we could
keep warms, in the hopes that we could find one another, someways,
somehows.

thanks to his modest efforts there are now 8+ billion, instantly
accessible, web-pages that didn't exist 10 years ago.

that's nothing to sneeze at.

ya think?

planet earth owes a man like mr. behlendorf a living, but yet, it
keeps throwing nonsense like the bush administration and things like
the rave act at him and people like him and us.

what's up with that?

things are all fucked up inside out and backwards here and it's no
wonder a movie with a title like:

'sideways'

struck such a chord with so many people.

anyways, i don't know any other way to put it, 'cept to say, happy
fucking birthday, and thank you 4 being you.

many happy fucking returns.

peace the fuck out,

nwa

ps: it kills me that this thug will become musically immortal because
of this riff, but here goes:

"Go, go, go, go
Go, go, go shorty!
It's your birthday!
We gon' party like it's yo birthday!
We gon' sip Bacardi like it's your birthday!
And you know we don't give a fuck!
It's not your birthday! "

hear, hear.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Happy Birthday Brian Behlendorf & SFRaves / SFRCal
 (in advance)!

I am very grateful for Apache - after all, many of the websites I host, am 
webmistress of, boxes I ch0wn, test or develop on, applications I use, etc 
run in Apache webserver environment.

Taz, the box I'm connecting from, which gives life to 
Hyperreal.org and SFRaves.org runs Apache...

I am very appreciative of this technology that Mr Behlendorf, a friend 
named Brian co-authored and gave life to not only as a innovative open 
source project, but a technology that has standardized a way of software 
development and freedom of information like none other - Open Source - 
Apache is an innovation of of higher power of software development.

I concur with his notion that there are many cases where innovation and 
creativity in Software Development have been squashed by commercialization 
/ profit driven software development; in effect has made many an attempt 
"rip the soul out of development"; I believe in his axiom of having a 
higher purpose in software through an increase in colloboration, trust and 
transparency.

Historically, Apache's history is colorful. In the beginning:

"...Brian Behlendorf says he's not a very good programmer because "I use 
trial and error a little too much." Yet at the ripe old age of 21, 
Behlendorf orchestrated one of the most successful business software 
projects ever. He and fellow developers produced Apache, the free server 
software that today powers 70% of all Web sites. If copies of Apache were 
sold for the same price as Microsoft's comparable server software, its 
sales would total over $500 million. But Behlendorf didn't make a dime off 
it..." Forbes 03.14.05

  "...To serve up the Web pages Organic hosted for companies, Behlendorf 
used free, open source server software maintained by faculty and students 
at the University of Illinois' National Center for Supercomputing 
Applications. The project was left to wither in 1994 when Netscape hired 
away most of the tech-savvy Illinois students. Behlendorf adopted the code 
and put in the groundwork for a hierarchy-free meritocracy. Developers 
with lots of successful work on Apache gain access to tweak the code 
directly. He set up a mailing list to coordinate updates and bug fixes, 
and helped create a voting system to approve work. New code requires three 
plus votes and no vetos. If a developer votes no, he or she has to help 
improve the project. Apache surpassed Sun's and Microsoft's rival servers 
in only six months, in part because the software was free."It was the 
world's most efficient R&D effort," says Behlendorf..." Forbes 03.14.05

"..Now, at the riper age of 31, Behlendorf is realizing where his true 
strengths lie:influencing people to change the way they do things. In his 
new role as technosocial scientist, Behlendorf travels the world exhorting 
companies to work together to take back control of their software 
destinies from the Microsofts, Oracles and SAPsof the world. Only a third 
of software outlays go for canned code from Microsoft and its competitors; 
the other two-thirds pay for legions of in-house programmers at places 
like Boeing, Bank of America and Wal-Mart. There's no reason they should 
be working in isolation. Write code together, share it, swap it and get 
the job done faster, cheaper and more efficiently..." 	Forbes 03.14.05

It's fantastic to read about you Brian in Forbes Magazine :)

http://www.forbes.com/business/forbes/2005/0314/073.html
http://www.forbes.com/business/forbes/2005/0314/073_2.html

I remember when Apache.org, python.org among others were virtually hosted 
side by side with Hyperreal, like opensource.org (taz hosts many 
resourceful sites) - among some Hyperreal host now - some of my favorites: 
(too many to list)

bbs.hyperreal.org
compassion.org
ecstacy.org
erowid.org
djsets.hyperreal.org
grid.hyperreal.org
machines.hyperreal.org
microsound.com
media.hyperreal.org
moby.org
music.hyperreal.org
opensource.org
rhythm.org
sfjungle.com
sflnc.com
sisterdjs.com
squishy.org
sushi.org
theorb.com
trainspotter.hyperreal.org
vjmc.org

etc :)

13 years in the making, a teenager grows up.
31 years in the flesh, what a blessing.

Happy Birthday Brian!
Thank you for Who You Are:

Thank you for Where You Are (and what you've inspired):

http://www.collab.net/ 
http://www.behlendorf.com/~brian/
http://www.collab.net/
http://www.apache.org/
http://www.hyperreal.org/
http://www.sfraves.org/

Thanks for everything - the good times, your friendship, your 
contributions to the world, the listservs, the webserver, the resources, 
-> I won't forget vrave, grid, sfrcal, sfraves and hyperreal.org et al 
created through our collective contribution that rings the bells of reedom 
of information that is spirit of Hyperreal in this Temporary Autonomous 
Zone.

RIP TAZ (1992-1999)
Carpe Diem Taz3 (1999-Present)

<3 Karina

PS - I <3 command line, non-html, pine mode lynx livin it up :)
I can appreciate a good gui, as long as it is chewy :)

PPS: Resquiat in Pace (even though some are still in use)
WAIS, GOPHER, KERMIT, WYSE DUMMY TERMINALS AND XSERVERS, nsf.net

I <3 unix and usenix

Subject: [sfraves] Wink & Studio Z lastnight

OK.. sooooooooooooo much unexpected fun lastnight man... YUM!!!

OK.. so like 1st off, I went 2 school, normal Wed night, then on my way
home eerrr. 2 BART, I made a pit stop @ Butter 2 well.. the 1st night of a
new Weeklie.. why not.. gotta support since i know 1/2 the DJs on there
who are residents... so yeah

Oooooooooh my gosh man.. ROOZ was there opening the night.. Hello 2day...
it has been waaaaaaay 2 long since him & kicked it...  so that was
sooooooo Dope!!!  Wow... his set was like Wow.. 'cause last time I heard
him spin... he spun Trance & told me he was goin' in2 house.. so that was
CooL 'cause he was fuckin' Rockin' the HOuse... Really Mellow like I
guess... I mean... almost Tribal I guess w/ a small hint of disco kinda
funky stuff... I Loved it!!!

But I dunno.... I thought that there was gonna be like all the residents
showingup 2 kick it, but that wasn't the case & it was only well.. Rooz &
his DJ mafia Crew... LoL.. I did Groove 4 a while....

So i dunno.. I felt kinda bad like leaving early in his set, but I was
just thinkin' like, "OK.. I was here, showed up, I gotta get home & watch
'The Division' on LIfetime"... so I said my bye 2 evey1 there who works @
Butter & walked up 11th 1 go 2 bart...

So I'm walkin' & I hear Jungle all of a sudden & I stop & listen.. oh
shit.. I was in front of Studio Z.. OH SHIT, I promised 2 be there 'cause
the promoters wanted me there WEEEEEEEEEKS ago!  I also heard my name
"OSBY" when I was standing there like tryin' 2 not B confuzed & it was my
Big Sis Angelica who I been YAY... & Ivry was w/ her & he asked me if I
wanted 2 walk in w/ them, so I did... YAY

OK.. Kinetik was on the decks... when we got in there.. YUM.. I mean.. he
was like playing like really hard style DNB raga beats. .it was Dope!!!
Ummm... Aye~N & Ivry went on next (& 4 sake of like not knowing the right
term & 2 just say' something that described it) & they played some hard
bounce dub the way I like it!oh gosh.. who went on next.. ummm.. ok...
oh.. Raise & 4Real went on next & fuck man... it got more Hard & Bouncy I
mea.. like ooh.. I Love when 4 Real spins 'cause he just knows what 2 play
like I can't expplain it but I've always called him 1 of my fave Jungle
DJs 'cause he always plays what I wanna hear.. well.. be it that it was
this tag set!!  But yeah.. Raise didn't play 2 much Rock Jungle this time
around lastnight.. LoL...  OK :::Pause:::

I then went back 2 Butter 'cause I figured I was still in the area &
well.. see who was there.. YAY!!  Saw Marco & Travis.. YAY!!! Saw ummm..
grrr... what's his name.. ummm.. the Dude I met like 6 yrs ago @
Maritime... who spinds now.. ummm.. lol... Aaron Jae jus finished up an
Awesome set there of Yummy Breakbeats & Pistachio went on next.. damn.. he
dropped in the set pretty hard there & well.. I wsn't sure if he started
out spinning a lil' breakbeats @ the begining & just casually got in 2
like the Proggy house.. but man.. I Loved what I heard!!!  YAY!!!

Then after hangin' out there 4 a while & kickin' it w/ like every1 there &
hmm.. got in some pictures... went back 2 Studio Z.. YAY!!!

Xplisit was on the decks.. WOW.. he was playing "It's Gonna Be a Fine Day
Tonight" jungle remix... oh shit.. it was Dope.. but man... Xplisit went
hard w/ his set & played just some hard stuff the rest off the night...
Kinetik did jump back in & play some light dubby stuff in the middle of
the hard.. it was actually neat when that happen!!

All in all, it was a Groovy adventure!!  Oh yeah.. so Xplisit said he'd
take me home & just as we got off the bridge, his car stalled.. his wife
Jenna picked us up & we wnet  Emerville afer that then decided they needed
2 go back home & I had 2 bart back home after all which i was proposing
all along b4 he insisted on taking me home... so we got 2 the toll & her
car broke down & well.. i was finally aboe 2 stick sticker on those yellow
things @ the toll booths...

Finally got 2 the City & their pad around liek 3:45.. & then they fed me
food!  LoL.. Dope!!!  Then i ended up like gettint home around 6:45 by my
fave bus driver in the world after bart & all that stuff! =)

Fun Times!


-- 
Take Care <3
Peace=->Jus' Me =-> ObY {8O)

The US is:  "...a nation of 200 million used-car salesmen with all the 
money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the 
world who tries to make us uncomfortable."
-Hunter S. Thompson

"Death is our eternal companion.  It is always to our left, at an arm's 
length.  It has always been watching you.  It always will until the day it 
taps you.  The thing to do when you're impatient is...to turn to your left 
and ask advice from death.  An immense amount of pettiness is dropped if 
your death makes a gesture to you, or if you catch a glimpse of it, or if 
you just catch the feeling that your companion is there watching you."
-Carlos Castaneda

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Then did he raise on high the Holy Hand Grenade of Antioch, saying,
"Bless this, O Lord, that with it thou mayst blow thine enemies to
tiny bits, in thy mercy." And the people did rejoice and did feast
upon the lambs and toads and tree-sloths and fruit-bats and orangutans
and breakfast cereals ... Now did the Lord say, "First thou pullest
the Holy Pin. Then thou must count to three. Three shall be the number
of the counting and the number of the counting shall be three. Four
shalt thou not count, neither shalt thou count two, excepting that
thou then proceedeth to three. Five is right out. Once the number
three, being the number of the counting, be reached, then lobbest thou
the Holy Hand Grenade in the direction of thine foe, who, being
naughty in my sight, shall snuff it.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Happy Birthday Brian Behlendorf & SFRaves / SFRCal (in advance)!

Dustin De Wynde <nwa420@gmail.com> said...
> umm, and let us not forget the role Brian had in birthing, oh, say..... 
> 
> Apache. 
> 
> without which *none* of us would even be having *any* of this blessed
> conversation on the internets.
> 
> picture this.....
> 
> no listservs, googles, yahoos, streaming porns, p2p-mp3s, flash, sql,
> live blogging, emailsies, well no, wait that might still exist in
> crappy command line, non-html, pine mode, the list is endlesss......
> 
> none of it.


Not to diminish Brians considerable contribution, but apache is not
the www. It is fallacious to imply the web would not exist without
apache. It most certainly would.

Perhaps better to say that apache gave us free and corporate
unhindered web serving early on. Combined with Linux, this really
opened the door to letting the everyman be a webmaster, kicking open
Pandoras box *before* the corporate could gain momentum and tie it
down with controls.

So I see Brian's contribution not so much being that the www
exists... I consider it's existence inevitable. Rather, I see it as
key to it's open (and unsupressable) character that we enjoy.

Sean

Date: Fri, 18 Mar 2005 14:43:06 -0800
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
From: Apollo <apollo@speakeasy.org>
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="=====================_6057980==.ALT"
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Sunset Postponed

--=====================_6057980==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

PacificSound *
415.820.1664

As many of you know, the last Sunset Party of 2004 was rained out. Well, it 
looks as though we are still lurking under this dark and wet cloud for 
Sunday. Instead of waiting till the last minute to see if the weather will 
clear for us we have decided to make an earlier decision and postpone this 
Sundays Sunset Party until April 10th. This is being done for several reasons.

1st from the Rangers: it seems pretty promising that even if it doesn't 
actually rain on Sunday the ground will be saturated and wet which will 
cause the grass to be certainly torn up badly with our large group, not to 
mention uncomfortable to sit on. This ground saturation also effects the 
extended parking lots of Stafford Lake, these will turn to mud and cause 
stuck cars.

2nd from us: By making this decision now we will save hundreds of dollars 
in costs for the day by being able to cancel portable toilets, the truck, 
and generator rental with plenty of notice. We lost this money last year 
with our late cancelation and cannot afford to do this again since we just 
do not have the financial resources to throw away money like that. As we 
have said before this event costs nearly $1500 to put on. Now, there is the 
slight chance we could pull off the event between storms, but that is just 
not where we are at after a decade of Sunset Parties. Especially for the 
1st Sunset party off the year where we want everyone to come and enjoy 
spring together in the sun. And especially in a year where we are doing 
less events and want each one to be as special as it can be.

So please pass the word that we will be back in action in a few weeks. 
April 10th is first available date that will work with the Park and our 
schedules, so hopefully this will also give you all a chance to get work 
off again, change flights, and rental cars. So, in this fashion we will be 
bringing in Spring with a storm of our own...back to back weekends of fun 
since the 1st Boat party of the year will happen on April 17th on a Brand 
New Boat for us with greater capacity and a gem of the San Francisco Bay...

money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the 
world who tries to make us uncomfortable."
-Hunter S. Thompson

"Death is our eternal companion.  It is always to our left, at an arm's 
length.  It has always been watching you.  It always will until the day it 
taps you.  The thing to do when you're impatient is...to turn to your left 
and ask advice from death.  An immense amount of pettiness is dropped if 
your death makes a gesture to you, or if you catch a glimpse of it, or if 
you just catch the feeling that your companion is there watching you."
-Carlos Castaneda

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Most Sampled Woman in Hip-Hop Mourned

"it takes two to make things go right....."

you know the jam.

-b


The `Most Sampled Woman in Hip-Hop' Mourned
By Davey D

Last weekend, hip-hop lost one of its great icons. But sadly, not a
whole lot of us have taken time to acknowledge her.

Singer Lyn Collins earned a spot in hip-hop history as one of the
culture's key architects. Those who grew up listening to artists like
Foxy Brown, Lil' Kim, Trina and Jacki-O may never have heard of
Collins. Those who grew up on Queen Latifah, MC Lyte, Salt-N-Pepa and
Roxanne Shante heard echoes of Collins in their music, though they may
have not realized it. Those who came up in the era of pioneers such
as Queen Lisa Lee, Pebbly Poo and Mercedes Ladies, to name a few, will
of course remember Collins, though it was years later that she made
her greatest contributions to hip-hop. Gloria Lyn Collins was born on
June 12, 1948, in Lexington, Texas. She got her start when she hooked
up with two relatives -- a guy named Catfish and another named Bootsy
-- to do some singing. Oh yes, you read that right: the Bootsy
Collins of Parliament/Funkadelic fame.

'Debt to James Brown'

In the early '70s, when hip-hop was rising from the rubble and ashes
of the Bronx, a man by the name of James Brown ``discovered'' Lyn and
her relatives, who joined his band. The rest, as they say is history.
Collins, an electrifying musician with a powerful voice, sang backup
for Brown. She stood out from his singers, and the Godfather of Soul
nicknamed her the Female Preacher.

In 1972, Collins released a solo album with the classic jam ``Think
(About It),'' which would be instrumental in earning Collins her place
in hip-hop. For starters it was a staple heard often at early hip-hop
jams. Second, it was used in the megahit ``It Takes Two,'' by Rob
Base and DJ EZ Rock, which many consider to be one of the most
influential rap records of all time. It's Collins' sampled voice we
hear singing, ``It takes two to make a thing go right.'' The song has
been sampled more than 100 times, making Collins ``the most sampled
woman in hip-hop.''

As if that weren't enough, Collins had more hit records through the
years, including ``Mama Feelgood,'' ``Rock Me Again and Again'' and
``Take Me As I Am.''

We caught up with singer-producer Bowlegged Lou of the legendary
hip-hop band Full Force, who has produced music for James Brown. Lou
said, ``Anyone that was associated with James Brown's band means a lot
to hip-hop . . . but Lyn Collins was, in my opinion, the most
soulful and most popular of the James Brown female singers. You also
had Vicki Anderson and Marva Whitney, but Lyn was a great,
no-holds-barred singer, and all us hip-hop musicians, artists and
music lovers held her songs in high regard.''

Lou went on to say that many hip-hop producers know Collins' name but
not her legacy, and many hip-hop artist don't know her name but know
her voice.

``We were fortunate to produce James' comeback album in 1988, and he
told us lots of great stories about Lyn Collins,'' Lou said. ``She
will be missed.''

`Classy and sassy'

University of California-Berkeley professor and ``History of Funk''
broadcaster Rickey Vincent said, ``Lyn Collins was the most glamorous
of the James Brown singers. She elevated the whole production when
she joined the band. She was classy and sassy and represented
womanhood to a generation who were weaned on James Brown and the Black
Power movement. She let women know you could be strong, sassy and
powerful and feminine at the same time, which wasn't easy.'' Vincent
noted that, at the time of her death at age 56, Collins was still
touring, a testament to her staying power.

``If hip-hop is going to show respect for the elders who are sampled
in our songs, then they should spend a little time and respect the
life path they went through,'' Vincent added. ``Lyn Collins is
definitely someone worth knowing.''

--

PacificSound <sunset@pacificsound.net> wrote:
Date: Fri, 18 Mar 2005 13:33:54 -0800
Subject: <<<TRANSIT tonite...SUNSET postponed!!>>> 

* PacificSound *
415.820.1664

As many of you know, the last Sunset Party of 2004 was rained out. Well, it looks as though we are still lurking under this dark and wet cloud for Sunday. Instead of waiting till the last minute to see if the weather will clear for us we have decided to make an earlier decision and postpone this Sundays Sunset Party until April 10th. This is being done for several reasons. 

1st from the Rangers: it seems pretty promising that even if it doesn't actually rain on Sunday the ground will be saturated and wet which will cause the grass to be certainly torn up badly with our large group, not to mention uncomfortable to sit on. This ground saturation also effects the extended parking lots of Stafford Lake, these will turn to mud and cause stuck cars. 

2nd from us: By making this decision now we will save hundreds of dollars in costs for the day by being able to cancel portable toilets, the truck, and generator rental with plenty of notice. We lost this money last year with our late cancelation and cannot afford to do this again since we just do not have the financial resources to throw away money like that. As we have said before this event costs nearly $1500 to put on. Now, there is the slight chance we could pull off the event between storms, but that is just not where we are at after a decade of Sunset Parties. Especially for the 1st Sunset party off the year where we want everyone to come and enjoy spring together in the sun. And especially in a year where we are doing less events and want each one to be as special as it can be. 

So please pass the word that we will be back in action in a few weeks. April 10th is first available date that will work with the Park and our schedules, so hopefully this will also give you all a chance to get work off again, change flights, and rental cars. So, in this fashion we will be bringing in Spring with a storm of our own...back to back weekends of fun since the 1st Boat party of the year will happen on April 17th on a Brand New Boat for us with greater capacity and a gem of the San Francisco Bay...

Thank you all for understanding and we'll see you tonite at Transit ; )
<<<~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~>>>

Subject: RE: [sfraves] recent john tejada set

Ok - so here it is 7 months later and I finally got around to listening to 
this mix, lol. I know - sad as hell, right?

Well, it's a SICK mix. Blippy and glitchy in spots, funky and chunky in 
spots. Most of the mixing is spot on with a couple of VERY minor slips that 
last all of a millisecond.

Tech-house touches me in my happy spot.

Go listen.

Date: Fri, 18 Mar 2005 23:01:52 -0800
From: shawn allen <shawn@alterior.net>
To: sfraves <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Message-ID: <20050319070152.GI9889@hubble>
Mail-Followup-To: shawn allen <shawn@alterior.net>,
	sfraves <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Disposition: inline
User-Agent: Mutt/1.4.2.1i
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] new (old) mix: Slow Down!

So this thing has been languishing on my hard drive since last August. I
recently resurrected it from an old backup, and thought it was pretty
cool so I'm sharing it with you. Fair warning: this ain't no dance mix.
It's much better suited for zoning out at work, smoking something
illicit, recovering from a nasty hangover, or making out.

The title refers to the fact that this is--by far--the slowest mix I've
ever done. I just hit record one day when I was listening to some new
records, and once I noticed that it was sounding good I gathered up some
older stuff and threw it into the mix. A few records in, I realized that
I was pitching things waaaay down to keep in step. Turns out the track I
started things off with was about 120bpm! Anyway, give it a listen if
that sounds interesting. Fans of so-called "heroin house", dub, and IDM
will not want to miss this.

Shazbot presents: Slow Down!
<http://shazbotica.com/audio/shazbot-slow_down.mp3>

1. Booka Shade - Vertigo [Get Physical Music]
2. Pig & Dan - 24 Hour People [Submission]
3. Ricardo Villalobos - Bach to Back [Playhouse]
4. Estornel/Pucher - Ode To A Girl [Onitor]
5. Monne Automne - Automne [Lofi Stereo]
6. Echopilot - Deeper Function [Morris Audio Citysport Edition]
7. John Tejada & Arian Leviste - Ghetto Platypus [Palette]
8. Sunsetpeople - Mifune [Get Physical Music]
9. Eriko Tanabe - I Like To Wear My Tanga [Morris Audio]
10. John Tejada - Present Pretense [Tigersushi]
11. Nimbus - Nothing [Iron Box Music]
12. Ricardo Villalobos - 808 The Bass Queen [Lofi Stereo]
13. 2 Dollar Egg - Lync [i220]

More on the way from the archives, and maybe a new mix this weekend if
the weather stays crappy!

Toodles,
-- 
shawn allen
  mailto://shawn@alterior.net
  phone://+1.415.577.3961
  http://alterior.net
  aim://shawnpallen


---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

hey, good stuff.
 
carlos, aka dj pistachio

shawn allen <shawn@alterior.net> wrote:
So this thing has been languishing on my hard drive since last August. I
recently resurrected it from an old backup, and thought it was pretty
cool so I'm sharing it with you. Fair warning: this ain't no dance mix.
It's much better suited for zoning out at work, smoking something
illicit, recovering from a nasty hangover, or making out.

The title refers to the fact that this is--by far--the slowest mix I've
ever done. I just hit record one day when I was listening to some new
records, and once I noticed that it was sounding good I gathered up some
older stuff and threw it into the mix. A few records in, I realized that
I was pitching things waaaay down to keep in step. Turns out the track I
started things off with was about 120bpm! Anyway, give it a listen if
that sounds interesting. Fans of so-called "heroin house", dub, and IDM
will not want to miss this.

Shazbot presents: Slow Down!


1. Booka Shade - Vertigo [Get Physical Music]
2. Pig & Dan - 24 Hour People [Submission]
3. Ricardo Villalobos - Bach to Back [Playhouse]
4. Estornel/Pucher - Ode To A Girl [Onitor]
5. Monne Automne - Automne [Lofi Stereo]
6. Echopilot - Deeper Function [Morris Audio Citysport Edition]
7. John Tejada & Arian Leviste - Ghetto Platypus [Palette]
8. Sunsetpeople - Mifune [Get Physical Music]
9. Eriko Tanabe - I Like To Wear My Tanga [Morris Audio]
10. John Tejada - Present Pretense [Tigersushi]
11. Nimbus - Nothing [Iron Box Music]
12. Ricardo Villalobos - 808 The Bass Queen [Lofi Stereo]
13. 2 Dollar Egg - Lync [i220]

More on the way from the archives, and maybe a new mix this weekend if
the weather stays crappy!

Toodles,
-- 
shawn allen
mailto://shawn@alterior.net
phone://+1.415.577.3961
http://alterior.net
aim://shawnpallen

At 12:13 PM 3/19/2005, Van Mundegaarde wrote:
>I was told (not that I am 100% positive about the info tho), that you 
>should book tours about a month in advance due to serious demand . Anyone 
>know if that sounds accurate?
>
>~M
>

I think it depends on the time of year.  During the summer tourist season 
it's quite difficult to obtain tickets at the ferry office.  However, it 
shouldn't be a problem in the spring.  Joey and I just went down there on 
an impulse one day, bought tickets, and did the rock.  Much 
fun.  http://www.blueandgoldfleet.com/ for info.

If it's convenient we just might join ya all.

Love,

Apollo

The US is:  "...a nation of 200 million used-car salesmen with all the 
money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the 
world who tries to make us uncomfortable."
-Hunter S. Thompson

"Death is our eternal companion.  It is always to our left, at an arm's 
length.  It has always been watching you.  It always will until the day it 
taps you.  The thing to do when you're impatient is...to turn to your left 
and ask advice from death.  An immense amount of pettiness is dropped if 
your death makes a gesture to you, or if you catch a glimpse of it, or if 
you just catch the feeling that your companion is there watching you."
-Carlos Castaneda

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Wow...big surprise here.

Virginity Pledges Fail to Protect Teens from STDs

Contributed by Gina Borgsdof | 19 March, 2005  19:43 GMT


'Teens, regardless of whether they have a taken a virginity pledge, are 
engaging in behaviors that put them at risk for STDs and unintended 
pregnancy. It is vitally important that we provide all teens with the 
information and skills they need to protect themselves.'

"Virginity pledges" -- that is, public promises to remain virgins until 
marriage -- do not protect the young people who make them from the risk of 
engaging in unsafe sexual practices that could lead to sexually transmitted 
diseases (STDs), suggests a new study published in the March 18, issue of 
the Journal of Adolescent Health.

In fact, the study participants who made the virignity pledges contracted 
STDs at the same rate as their peers who had not pledged. The pledgers were 
less likely to use condoms to prevent STDs, and they were less likely to 
seek medical testing and treatment, increasing possibility of transmission, 
the researchers found.

Alternative Behaviors

Study authors Hannah Bruckner of Yale University and Peter Bearman of 
Columbia University concluded that some pledgers engaged in alternative 
sexual behaviors in order to preserve their virginity. In fact, among those 
who had not had vaginal intercourse, pledgers were more likely to have 
engaged in both oral and anal sex than their non-pledging peers.

Among virgins, male and female pledgers were six time more likely to have 
had oral sex than non-pledgers, and male pledgers were four times more 
likely to have had anal sex than those who had not pledged, the research 
shows.

"This research confirms what we have known for a long time," says Bill 
Smith, vice president for public policy at the Sexuality Information and 
Education Council of the United States (SIECUS). "Teens, regardless of 
whether they have a taken a virginity pledge, are engaging in behaviors 
that put them at risk for STDs and unintended pregnancy. It is vitally 
important that we provide all teens with the information and skills they 
need to protect themselves," Smith continues.

'Enough Is Enough'

Virginity pledges are the cornerstone of many federally funded 
abstinence-only-until-marriage programs. Since 1982, the U.S. government 
has spent over a billion dollars on unproven abstinence-only-until-marriage 
programs. Of that billion, $620 million dollars has been spent in just the 
last seven years.

Under the leadership of President Bush, there has been a continued 
expansion of investment in these programs with $168 million allocated in 
Fiscal Year 2005 alone. Now, the President is seeking an all-time high of 
$206 million in his proposed Fiscal Year 2006 budget. These programs are 
prohibited from discussing contraceptives except in the context of failure 
rates and have never been proven effective.

"Not only do virginity pledges not work to keep our young people safe, they 
are causing harm by undermining condom use, contraception and medical 
treatment," says Smith. "Enough is enough. It is time for lawmakers to stop 
pushing their ideological agenda at the expense of young people and fund 
comprehensive and medically accurate sexuality education programs that 
work," Smith urges.

http://health.dailynewscentral.net/content/view/000530/37/




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


The US is:  "...a nation of 200 million used-car salesmen with all the 
money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the 
world who tries to make us uncomfortable."
-Hunter S. Thompson

"Death is our eternal companion.  It is always to our left, at an arm's 
length.  It has always been watching you.  It always will until the day it 
taps you.  The thing to do when you're impatient is...to turn to your left 
and ask advice from death.  An immense amount of pettiness is dropped if 
your death makes a gesture to you, or if you catch a glimpse of it, or if 
you just catch the feeling that your companion is there watching you."
-Carlos Castaneda

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

east bay tonite!





Come burn it down with us in Oakland tonight!

!!!!!ROOTS HARDCORE!!!!!! presents RUCKUS MASSIVE
a celebration of urban soundsystem culture

*Ragga
Jungle*Hip-Hop*Roots*Dancehall*Dub*Grime*Harcore
Tekno*
+*Breakcore

Saturday March 19th, 2005
West Oakland (take a wild guess...?!)

3 Rooms of Rugged Dance Sound
w/ Soundsystems: 5lowershop (www.5lowershop.org, SF)
S.P.A.Z. (www.spaz.org)
R.A.T.S.T.A.R. (SF)

10pm-6am $8donation ALL AGES

In the Bashment Room:
Roots Reggae/Dancehall/Rock Steady/Dub/Grime w/

Cuba (Tuf Luv Resistance)
Dr.Izzz (Army of Love Sound, 5lowershop)
Cisko Kid (Tuf Luv Resistance)
Selector 138 (Tuf Luv Resistance)
Wizzkey (A.M. Radio)
Savage Rhythm (Spaz)
Uncle Ouija (Spaz/5lowershop)

with MCs Razorblade and Mama Veteran!!! (SF)

In the Main Dancehalls:

El Juan Hubbard: Technostate, Hijynx, SF
[Ragga Junglist Extraordinaire]

DJ Agana: Oaklandish, Oakland
[selecta queen w/ latin beats: hip-hop en espanol and
reggaeton]

Aneurysm: tigerbeat6, tbi, Oakland
[Dogtown's bad-ass: breakcore, ragga, hip-hop and
hardcore]

Kontroversy396: tbi, Oakland
[LIVE hip-hop, jungle and turntablism burnin' out the
West O.]

Necrotic Socks: 5lowershop, SF
[LIVE tag-team breakcore noise destruction]

Jack Klang: 5lowershop, SF
[four to the floor hard tekno, breakcore and jungle]

Tin Rock-IT: T.R.I., Oakland
[insurrectionary hip-hop and big booty bitchcore]

the Stapler: sofat!, 5lowershop, SF
[brand new LIVE set sick ass ragga jungle and drum and
bass]

d3cibot: S.P.A.Z.
[LIVE dark experimental decibotic breaks]

Aviatrix: 5lowershop, SF
[dark breaks, hip-hop and hardcore]

Soeul Roots: Filthee Immigrants, Oakland
[hip-hop from the Filthee crew to make you move]

Skwerly: tbi, 5lowershop, SF
[LIVE hardcore and weirdness]

Malice: katabatik, Oakland
[breakcore, hip hop and hardcore]

dJ ocelot: ROOTS HARDCORE, 5lowershop, SF
[jump up hardstep ragga jungle core]

Music and Arts Lounge:
Fashion and crafts for sale from local artisans
Record Distro from Cable Records
CD Release from the first ROOTS HARDCORE! Sink your
teeth into the 
5lowershop Sessions, you know what went on in the
basement!

Plus!
de-consculpture by Brandon Gobi
Renegade art documentary short on West Oakland artist
Eric Groeff: 
shown and made by EmJay P8
Sushi bar in the Bashment Room: by Rhianna

email for more info

Directions:
By Bike: Adaline, Mandela Parkway are good for
north/south access. 
27th, Grand Ave are good for East/West access.

By Public Transit:
#19 bus (from West Oakland or North Berkeley BART)
goes down Peralta. 
Get off at Peralta & 26th
#14 bus (from Macarthur BART,) goes down Adeline. Get
off at Adeline 
& 26th, walk 2 blocks west (away from Downtown
Oakland) to Union.

By Car From San Francisco: Stay in the far right lane
when exiting 
the Bay Bridge. Take West Grand exit. Go straight for
6 lights & turn 
left on Union St (no light). 26th is 2 blocks down.

By Car From Berkeley: 80 West...Center lane to 880.
1st exit is West 
Grand. Turn left and left again on Union, which is the
street after 
the 4th light. Go 2 blocks to corner of 26th. If the
highways are 
clogged, head south on Adeline & turn right on 26th.
Go 2 blocks to 
union.

[dark breaks, hip-hop and hardcore]

Soeul Roots: Filthee Immigrants, Oakland
[hip-hop from the Filthee crew to make you move]

Skwerly: tbi, 5lowershop, SF
[LIVE hardcore and weirdness]

Malice: katabatik, Oakland
[breakcore, hip hop and hardcore]

dJ ocelot: ROOTS HARDCORE, 5lowershop, SF
[jump up hardstep ragga jungle core]

Music and Arts Lounge:
Fashion and crafts for sale from local artisans
Record Distro from Cable Records
CD Release from the first ROOTS HARDCORE! Sink your
teeth into the 
5lowershop Sessions, you know what went on in the
basement!

Plus!
de-consculpture by Brandon Gobi
Renegade art documentary short on West Oakland artist
Eric Groeff: 
shown and made by EmJay P8
Sushi bar in the Bashment Room: by Rhianna

email for more info

Directions:
By Bike: Adaline, Mandela Parkway are good for
north/south access. 
27th, Grand Ave are good for East/West access.

By Public Transit:
#19 bus (from West Oakland or North Berkeley BART)
goes down Peralta. 
Get off at Peralta & 26th
#14 bus (from Macarthur BART,) goes down Adeline. Get
off at Adeline 
& 26th, walk 2 blocks west (away from Downtown
Oakland) to Union.

By Car From San Francisco: Stay in the far right lane
when exiting 
the Bay Bridge. Take West Grand exit. Go straight for
6 lights & turn 
left on Union St (no light). 26th is 2 blocks down.

By Car From Berkeley: 80 West...Center lane to 880.
1st exit is West 
Grand. Turn left and left again on Union, which is the
street after 
the 4th light. Go 2 blocks to corner of 26th. If the
highways are 
clogged, head south on Adeline & turn right on 26th.
Go 2 blocks to 
union.

--- Apollo <apollo@speakeasy.org> wrote:

> 
> 
> Wow...big surprise here.
> 
> Virginity Pledges Fail to Protect Teens from STDs
> 
> Contributed by Gina Borgsdof | 19 March, 2005  19:43
> GMT
> 
> 
> 'Teens, regardless of whether they have a taken a
> virginity pledge, are 
> engaging in behaviors that put them at risk for STDs
> and unintended 
> pregnancy. It is vitally important that we provide
> all teens with the 
> information and skills they need to protect
> themselves.'
> 
> "Virginity pledges" -- that is, public promises to
> remain virgins until 
> marriage -- do not protect the young people who make
> them from the risk of 
> engaging in unsafe sexual practices that could lead
> to sexually transmitted 
> diseases (STDs), suggests a new study published in
> the March 18, issue of 
> the Journal of Adolescent Health.
> 
> In fact, the study participants who made the
> virignity pledges contracted 
> STDs at the same rate as their peers who had not
> pledged. The pledgers were 
> less likely to use condoms to prevent STDs, and they
> were less likely to 
> seek medical testing and treatment, increasing
> possibility of transmission, 
> the researchers found.
> 
> Alternative Behaviors
> 
> Study authors Hannah Bruckner of Yale University and
> Peter Bearman of 
> Columbia University concluded that some pledgers
> engaged in alternative 
> sexual behaviors in order to preserve their
> virginity. In fact, among those 
> who had not had vaginal intercourse, pledgers were
> more likely to have 
> engaged in both oral and anal sex than their
> non-pledging peers.
> 
> Among virgins, male and female pledgers were six
> time more likely to have 
> had oral sex than non-pledgers, and male pledgers
> were four times more 
> likely to have had anal sex than those who had not
> pledged, the research 
> shows.
> 
> "This research confirms what we have known for a
> long time," says Bill 
> Smith, vice president for public policy at the
> Sexuality Information and 
> Education Council of the United States (SIECUS).
> "Teens, regardless of 
> whether they have a taken a virginity pledge, are
> engaging in behaviors 
> that put them at risk for STDs and unintended
> pregnancy. It is vitally 
> important that we provide all teens with the
> information and skills they 
> need to protect themselves," Smith continues.
> 
> 'Enough Is Enough'
> 
> Virginity pledges are the cornerstone of many
> federally funded 
> abstinence-only-until-marriage programs. Since 1982,
> the U.S. government 
> has spent over a billion dollars on unproven
> abstinence-only-until-marriage 
> programs. Of that billion, $620 million dollars has
> been spent in just the 
> last seven years.
> 
> Under the leadership of President Bush, there has
> been a continued 
> expansion of investment in these programs with $168
> million allocated in 
> Fiscal Year 2005 alone. Now, the President is
> seeking an all-time high of 
> $206 million in his proposed Fiscal Year 2006
> budget. These programs are 
> prohibited from discussing contraceptives except in
> the context of failure 
> rates and have never been proven effective.
> 
> "Not only do virginity pledges not work to keep our
> young people safe, they 
> are causing harm by undermining condom use,
> contraception and medical 
> treatment," says Smith. "Enough is enough. It is
> time for lawmakers to stop 
> pushing their ideological agenda at the expense of
> young people and fund 
> comprehensive and medically accurate sexuality
> education programs that 
> work," Smith urges.
> 
>
http://health.dailynewscentral.net/content/view/000530/37/
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org
> 
> House Music 101: 
>
http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

> 
> "Death is our eternal companion.  It is always to
> our left, at an arm's 
> length.  It has always been watching you.  It always
> will until the day it 
> taps you.  The thing to do when you're impatient
> is...to turn to your left 
> and ask advice from death.  An immense amount of
> pettiness is dropped if 
> your death makes a gesture to you, or if you catch a

there were like people heeeeeeella freakin' each other lastnight during
that lst set & Catharsis showed up w/ tis Awesome punk rock Girl who
totally livened up the floor w/ her energy & man.. she was So Dope!!  Oh
oh oh... & Auntie Danny wqas there well.. he got there right as the last
record stopped playing like 10 mintues prior 2 his arrival... Love U!

OK... I gotta go.. but it was a fuckin' Awesome night!!!  Happy Birthday
Evil Breaks... Love y'all!!




-- 
Take Care <3
Peace=->Jus' Me =-> ObY {8O)

Subject: [sfraves] Thank you from Evil Breaks!

i just wanted to send a warm thanks to everyone who showed up to help
celebrate our Evil Breaks one year!  i saw LOTS of SFR folks at the
party and i wanted to let you know your presence was very much
appreciated.  i know the ticket price wasn't cheap (our most expensive
for a club event) and your support was not overlooked.

thank you to everyone who helped set up, clean up and who contributed
to this event.  a big shout out to our special guests General Midi and
Roxiller for dropping the ill sickness!  thank you to the dancers. 
thank you for your smiles and cheers.  thank you all for being a part
of this.

and for those that witnessed it, you know that our good friend Jauncy
totally outdid himself with the enormously epic ice sculpture!  it
contributed something special for the event and will not soon be
forgotten!  it was so dope lol omg!  <- osby impersonation

it's been a fantastic rollercoaster of a year for Evil Breaks! though
i think i'm the only crew member on the SFR list, i want to let all of
you know that your support and participation in our events has meant
the world to us.  we will continue our efforts to keep the vibe
positive and kickin, the dancefloor packed, the faces smiling, asses
shaking and the beats booming.

to our one year anniversary and all the years to come.  i can't wait
to see what the future has in store.  ;)

--

April 29th:  Thrust w/ Lee Coombs @ Mighty
April 30th:  TBA in Los Angeles
May 6th:  Beach Renegade
May 7th:  Reverb

Subject: [sfraves] Yerba Buena Island Paradise room for rent - $750 mon

CLICK HERE FOR PICTURES  http://www.f-8.com/home/roomforrent.html


Yerba Buena Island Paradise room for rent - $750 month
Private beach, free parking, all utilities INCLUDED! Free DSL Internet


Do you want to live on Yerba Buena Island? 

Commutes are easy as we hop onto the Bay Bridge in the middle with no
congestion or tolls. Driving to downtown SF is less than 10 minutes
and 15 mins to Berkeley or Oakland. MUNI stops at the end of the block
every 20 minutes to the Transbay Bus Terminal in SF, 24 hours a day.

Our unit is in the former Coast Guard Base in the middle of The Bay -
access to Oakland or SF by Bay Bridge. The island itself is a unique
and wonderful place to live. There's a police and fire station, making
it very safe. There's a store where basic supplies can be bought and
videos can be rented. There are public footpaths around the island
excellent for jogging/cycling, rollerblading, tennis courts,
basketball courts, soccer fields, a PRIVATE HIDDEN BEACH only a few
hundred feet away! and small Marina on Treasure Island. Breathtaking
views of SF, Alcatraz, Marin, Vallejo, Berkeley hills, Oakland,
Alameda, The Golden Gate Bridge, Bay Bridge, and San Rafael Bridge.


About our home 

Our home is three bedrooms, with a small garden area, free parking. It
has partial views of GG bridge, SF, Alcatraz, Marin and The Bay.
Amenities include shared bathroom, full size kitchen, large living
room and dining area. We have a nice entertainment center with a brand
new 53" HD television; Kitchen thats fully equipped with plenty of
cupboard space, microwave, dishwasher, garbage disposal, toaster oven,
gas range and oven, linoleum floor. Washing Machine / Dryer in the
house

House is mostly furnished with spare space for your stuff. We have
plenty of room and are also planning on getting some new furniture
depending on what you may have. The bedroom is not furnished Room is
wired for separate phone, cable, DSL. It has a closet in the room as
well as one right outside the door in the hallway. Nice new beige
berber carpeting. We do not have a house phone as we both have
cellphones but there is a line in your room if you would like to
activate it.


Available April 1st - $750 month 
First and Last month + 500 Security Deposit = $2000 total move in cost 

This includes ALL UTILITIES: water, electricity, gas, sewer, garbage,
cable tv, laundry, high speed internet - except telephone. (cable
internet potentially coming soon)

You: any age, sex, orientation, nationality welcome. Must be a DRAMA
FREE, clean, stable, professional person with a good stable job
wanting to move in by November 1st. We all pitch in on household
shopping such as toiletpaper, lightbulbs, laundry detergent, etc and
generally buy most of our own food but dont mind sharing everything as
long as its kept equal as far as purchases vs consumption.

There are currently two people living in the condo one in each of the
other bedrooms. We're both males in our mid 20's. We're both sane and
responsible, and easy to get along with. We have busy work and social
lives that keep us out and about most of the time but we do enjoy
spending some time hanging out at home. We occasionally have small
dinner gatherings here or friends over to watch a movie. One of us
works full time for a home audio/video install company, the other is a
bay area event/marketing director. We're looking for anyone that can
pay the rent on time, can help out in keeping the place clean from
time to time and just basically someone that we can get along with
enough to like living where we do. This is a one in a million location
that everyone loves. Once you see the island and the ultimate central
location, beauty, and amenities you will fall in love and never want
to move anywhere else!

Please reply with a little about yourself such as your job, your
average day/week routine, any furniture you have. Need proof of
employment and roomate references

Any Q's please feel free to email for the A's. 

SFRoomForRent@Gmail.com

Message-ID: <816b5dff05032201462e3ff4f8@mail.gmail.com>
Date: Tue, 22 Mar 2005 10:46:50 +0100
From: innocentchild <innocentchild@gmail.com>
Reply-To: innocentchild <innocentchild@gmail.com>
To: "sassy.munkees" <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] NRR :: greetings.from.berlin

Actually I just got out of Berlin and now I'm 2.5 hours north of there
in a lovely city called Hildesheim. Berlin was a blast. I even managed
to find an underground party that was held in an unmarked room under
the underground's tracks. We're talking old skool rave style where
you're walking down some shit hole alley and you see graffitti
everywhere including all over a door. Doesn't look like where you
should be, but yet - you open that door and suddenly you're greeted to
a tiny 2 room space with people smashed in there. It was all live
electroclash PA. Let's just say the live electroclash group in SF that
thinks they're edgey and cool - well, they'd be sent home crying after
what I saw. Pure raw energy and talent on stage that night. They even
had intermission acts with reenactments of that show Tutti Frutti
here. Then they started throwing fruit and later during a song
dedicated to a maxi-pad brand called smirk they started tossing
maxipads into the crowd. Tit's hanging out, electrical tape and bad
makeup with a one guy having hair like flock of seagulls really made
the night just pure fun. I need to find their *everyone is a dj*
track. You would all love it. No really LOVE IT. The crowd was
awesome, the beer was cheap (=E2=82=AC2) and it was only =E2=82=AC5 to get =
in. Felt
like home to me.

We didn't leave until 7:30am or something. People stayed until the end
too which seems to be rare these days at most parties. I didn't do
much site seeing, but I walked around berlin for hours and hours just
trying to get lost and find spots that I wouldn't if I had been
hitting up landmarks. If any of you ever decide to go make sure you
stay at The Circus hostel. So nice. So cheap. =E2=82=AC18/night and lockers
are free. You're across from the underground station at
Rosenthaler-Platz which makes getting around a breeze.  I can't get
enough D=C3=B6ner here. Turkish kabaab stuff.  I ate way too many of them.
There's a lot more to what I did but I'm lacking the energy to keep
typing more. Basically - went to Sage (club) and Space from Ibiza was
hosting. Trance. Ick. Not a bad club, but definitely a summer venue
because of the outdoor pool and open roof capability. Didn't hit up
Tresor. It closes in 2 weeks. Oh well...

I'll have pictures up and video too soon. For now I'm going back to
bed and getting myself better. Stupid being sick shit pisses me off.
Too much partying I guess...

---------------------------------------------------------------------
